Two players (or one player versus the computer) try to move across a randomly changing hexagonal board to reach the flag at the right of the screen. The players can only move on empty squares, while the solid moving squares cannot be crossed. Question marks will randomly move the player two hexagons. The goal is to reach the flag three times before the opponent. There are nine levels of computer difficulty.
title: Flag

description:
Formula 1 is a 1–2 player racing game for the Dragon 32/64.

Played on a horizontal split screen, each player controls a Formula 1 race car as they speed around an international race track. The camera view is from directly behind the vehicle, and players can accelerate, or turn left and right. The first player to complete the designated number of laps is the winner, and if the two vehicles contact each other, it's game over. Comes with a track editor to make custom designed tracks.
title: Formula 1

description:
Frankie is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls Frankie Stine, as he tries to escape the mayhem created by the evil Doctor Van Load. Frankie can move laterally and jump a short distance, and each level he must collect all the keys and proceed to the exit. There are a total of 100 levels and the player must navigate lifts, slides, collapsing and electric floors, moving platforms as well as the rock-dropping vampire bat flying across and guarding the exit. Egor, the evil doctor's willing slave, has been sent to make sure Frankie never makes it, as he scales the sides firing lightning bolts at the player. Frankie is equipped with a laser to neutralize bolts and other baddies that bounce about the screen, but this drains the player's rapidly depleting energy. If energy reaches 0 the player loses a life. Frankie starts with five lives in total.
title: Frankie

description:
Franklin in Wonderland is the fourth text adventure featuring Dan Diamond, private investigator.

Waking up from taking a snooze after eating a large cucumber sandwich in the woods, the player finds that everything has changed. Dan Diamond is transported to Wonderland, and post solve numerous puzzles related to the famous book. Contains puzzles involving changing size and numerous random events.
title: Franklin in Wonderland

description:
Free Parking is a 2–6 player board game for the Dragon 32/64.

Includes all features of Monopoly, including: buying, selling, and mortaging.
title: Free Parking

description:
Fruity is a 1-player gambling game for the Dragon 32/64.

A three spinner, fruit-themed, slot machine game. Players can score points on three horizontals or diagonals. Contains the ability to nudge or hold the three spinners, and can collect or gamble nudges. The player starts with twenty 10-pence credits.
title: Fruity

description:
Galactic Gus is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls Gus, the fighter pilot who is searching for fuel pods to refuel his fighter so that he can rejoin the Spaceship Dragon. Gus is situated in a rocket chair that must be steered around laser doors, monsters, and other surprises. Keys can be collected to unlock doors. Gus flies through a total of 215 individual maze-like screens, and starts with 8 lives.
title: Galactic Gus

description:
Galleons is a 1-player versus computer Battleship game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player competes against the computer to be the first to sink the other's armada of galleons, frigates, and rowing boats. Played on a 12 x 12 grid, the player and computer take turns firing onto the other's field to try to find and hit the vessels. Each field has 3 galleons, 5 frigates, and 3 rowing boats. There are 3 levels of computer difficulty, and the first player to sink their opponent's ships is the winner.
title: Galleons

description:
The Giant's Castle is a menu-based quiz/text adventure designed for children ages 3 - 11.

The player must try to rescue the maiden from the Giant's Castle, which is guarded by many foes. The castle is navigated by choosing where to travel next from a menu. The player starts with 5 lives, and encounters a variety of monsters. Monsters can be defeated by answering trivia questions. The player gain points by correctly answering the questions, but loses a life if they answer incorrectly. If the player gains 10 points they defeat the giant and rescue the princess.
title: The Giant's Castle

description:
Gi's a Job is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Yobbo is desperately trying to find a job as a top games programmer. Not an easy thing to do, especially when everyone is out to stop him. Yobbo can move laterally and headbutt a short distance ahead. He can also jump between platforms and to a great height, and the height of his jump is indicated by a small indicator at the bottom left of the screen. The longer the jump button is held, the higher he jumps from 1–8. If Yobbo hits the side of any objects or hits his head, he loses a life. The goal on each level is to defeat all the enemies by headbutting, and collecting all of the acorns. All enemies must be destroyed before the last acorn is collected. The player starts with three lives.
title: Gi's a Job

description:
Gnome Adventure is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

The player has been kidnapped by the Gnome Vizier, who commands the player to find and return the Gnome Diamond, which was captured by the Craig Gang. A curse has hit Gnomeland since its loss, and only a man is able to recover it.

All commands re via VERB NOUN entry. Save and restore are available.
title: Gnome Adventure

description:
Bugged is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player is trapped in their house, alone and with no protection. Suddenly, they are surrounded by killer bugs which charge directly towards them. In the house are giant bug eggs, and the bugs can be killed by pushing an egg towards them. Each wave has new bugs, but fewer bug eggs. The bugs can also eat the eggs if they walk across them, and the player can be left without any eggs to defend themselves. If an egg is pushed against a wall or another egg, it is destroyed. Starting on level 3, there are bug nests, which must be avoided or destroyed.

sample_screenshots.caption: Lots of Indy Bugs and Nests

title: Bugged!

description:
Golf is a 1–2 player sports game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player competes through 9 holes of golf (or 18 if repeating the same holes). The holes are graphically displayed on the screen, and the player aims by moving a pointer around the current ball position. Holes include the fairway, roughs, out of bounds, hazards, and greens. The power of a shot is determined by choosing the club, with two woods and seven irons. Wind speed/direction and ball position affect the shot. Upon landing on the green, game play enters a separate putting menu, where the power of the shot is selected from 1–30. Scores are tracked through all holes, and scoring is through the Stableford Points System.
title: Golf

description:
Golf is a sports game for 1 - 4 players.

The player competes through 9 holes of golf. The holes are graphically displayed on the screen, and the player aims by typing the direction of their swing from 0–360 degrees. Holes include the fairway, roughs, out of bounds, trees, bunkers, water, and the green. The power of a shot is determined by choosing the club from 1–9. Upon landing on the green, game play enters a separate putting display. Scores are tracked through all 9 holes.
title: Golf

description:
3-D Maze is a 1st-person maze game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player tries to move through a maze from south to north. Maze difficulty ranges from 5 to 95. The player can move in the cardinal directions or forward.
title: 3-D Maze

description:
A–Z Chase contains two games for the Dragon 32/64.

In A–Z Chase the player moves a spaceship laterally and tries to gather the letters A–Z while avoiding asteroids. The player gains points for each letter captured. Each game has 10 stages, and each stage includes five runs through the asteroid field to pick up letters. The points awarded for letters decreases with each run through the asteroids. If the player hits five asteroids it's game over. An additional version of the game has beacons which reward points if collected. There are five levels of difficulty which control ship speed.

In Moneybags, the player moves a hat laterally and tries to gather money bags that fall from the sky. If a moneybag is missed it stays on the ground. If any pile grows four bags tall it's game over.
title: A–Z Chase

description:
Arcade Action contains two action games for the Dragon 32/64.

Contains Meteor Run and Breakout.
title: Arcade Action

description:
Gamestape 2 contains two arcade games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Caterpillar
  • Space Attack
title: Gamestape 2

description:
Goblin Caves is a puzzle game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player moves through a series of interconnected rooms from a 1st person perspective. The are three hazards: goblins, boiling lava, and monsters. When the player is in a room next to a danger, the screen turns green, red, or blue respectively. The player has six arrows that they can shoot into an adjacent room with the goal to kill the monster. Arrows will also eliminate goblins. If the player fires into an empty room the location of all dangers are rearranged. If the player walks into a room with a danger it's game over.
title: Goblin Caves

description:
Haunted House is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

Enter and explore the ruined mansion. Numerous secrets and hidden rooms riddle the old house. The player must try to find all of the hidden treasures and escape the mansion alive.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is no save/restire feature.
title: Haunted House

description:
Invader is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a space base at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally, and can fire vertically up. An enemy alien ship moves laterally across the screen, dropping 1 level each trip across. The enemy ship fires towards the player. The player gains 100 points for each alien vessel destroyed. The player starts with 3 lives, and gains a bonus game at 1200 points.
title: Invader

description:
Simon is a memory game for the Dragon 32/62.

The player is briefly shown a string of numbers to memorize, and must correctly retype the sequence. Each time they are successful, the numbers are randomized again, but the string is lengthened by 1 number.
title: Simon

description:
Gordon Bennet! is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls Gordon in a platformer as he tries to collect all the diamonds on each level and reach the exit point to the next room. Gordon can jump a short distance, and must navigate elevators, moving platforms, dropping platforms, and numerous dangerous enemies. Gordon will lose a life if he falls an excessive distance. Gordon starts with five lives, and must explore a number of progressively difficult levels.
title: Gordon Bennet!

description:
Grand Prix is a 1–2 player racing game for the Dragon 32/64.

Two players, or one player versus the computer, race around a track from a top-down perspective trying to finish before their opponent. A clock keeps track of time, and the vehicle can be damaged by hitting the edge of the track or other vehicles. Oil slicks appear on the higher difficulties, potentially causing the car to go spinning off the road. At higher difficulties the vehicle is more difficult to navigate around turns. Players choose the number of laps and difficulty level, and there are a total of 8 different tracks to choose, featuring famous races from the Formula 1 circuit.
title: Grand Prix

description:
Nightflight is an aviation simulation for the Dragon 32/64.

The player attempts to take off, fly, and then land their aircraft at night using only their instrument displays and lighted runway to assist them. The player selects available fuel and wind variables at the beginning of the flight. The player can control the bank and attitude of their aircraft, increase or decrease power, increase or decrease their flaps, and can bring up or down their undercart.

The aircraft controls display altitude, air speed, heading and distance from runway, current visibility, and the status of their landing gear. Crashing the aircraft leads to game over.
title: Nightflight

description:
Red Meanies is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

As a member of the great star-faring race of Intergalactic Cheesesnufflers, the player finds themselves marooned in a maze somewhere beyond the farthest reaches of time and space. The maze seems to be populated by nothing but the Red Meanies. Fortunately, this maze is full of cheese for the player to ooze over.

Played from a 1st-person perspective, the player must gather all the cheeses located throughout the maze. A counter at the top left screen shows the Red Windsor cheese and green cheese from the Moons of Mooria remaining in the maze. When all cheese is eaten the maze refills once again. The player is constantly hunted by the Red Meanies. When green cheese is eaten, the Red Meanies are temporarily changed into passive Blue Loonies which can be eaten. The player starts with three lives, and loses a life if they come into contact with a Red Meanie.
title: Red Meanies

description:
Star Jammer is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The destruction of a mining outpost was the Federation's first warning of an attack by alien ships from a distant galaxy. As leader of the only squadron of fighters in the area, your first priority is to stop the alien fleet before it reaches the colonized planets.

Played from a 1st-person perspective, the player tries to shoot down incoming enemy ships. The goal is to maneuver the enemy ship into the crosshair at the center of the screen. There are several enemy ships, including: H-wings, X-wings, leaders, scouts, and commanders. The player can shoot five shots at a time before requiring to recharge, and has limited shielding. After each sector is cleared, the player enters a stargate to a new sector, and their shields are recharged.

Bonus fighters are awarded at 10,000 and 50,000 points.
title: Star Jammer

description:
Super Skill Hangman is a 1–2 player word construction game for the Dragon 32/64.

A word is displayed on the screen with blanks taking the place of letters. The player tries to guess the word by typing letters, but every incorrect guess adds a piece of a hangman to the screen. After 10 incorrect guesses, it's game over.

There are three levels of difficulty, and games can be timed or untimed. The player can miss three words before it's game over.
title: Super Skill Hangman

description:
Vulcan Noughts and Crosses is a 1–2 player board game for the Dragon 32/64.

Played on a 4 x 4 x 4 board, two players take turns placing pieces to try to score four in a row. Pieces are played by typing x, y, and z coordinates. A computer opponent is available for play.
title: Vulcan Noughts and Crosses

description:
The White Cliffs of Dover is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

After escaping from the German Chateau in Wings of War, the player now finds themselves driving through the French countryside in an old Citroën when their car crashes, and the player is flung out into the French countryside. They must avoid German patrols, infiltrate the French Resistance, and find a way back to Britain.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is a save/restore feature.
title: The White Cliffs of Dover

description:
For many years the mighty mages of the planet Xarg have been involved in a life and death struggle to decide the fate of the world. The world and the populace have been so ravaged by this war that the master mage Manuras of the Many Hues has put his foot down, and organised a final round of duels to decide who shall rule the planet. As the premier wizard of Xarg, the player has been selected to represent their faction in the final battle.

Designed for 2–9 players, two wizards enter combat at any time. At the beginning of combat the wizards' mana levels are displayed, and each player can choose a spell from four possible choices. The choice can be hidden or shown to their opponent. The game then goes to the duel display, where each player can launch their offensive or defensive spell. An animation of the attack is shown on the screen. A player with low mana can choose not to attack, and if both players choose defensive spells, the round is void. Spells require a varying amount of mana, and some spells can be steered on the screen to engage the opponent.
title: Wizard War

description:
Games Compendium is a collection of 6 games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Blackjack: 1–6 player game where the player tries to beat a computer opponent at blackjack.
  • Donkey Derby: Players bet on donkeys with different odds of winning a race.
  • Hunt the Wumpus: Search through 20 caves to kill the Wumpus, but avoid bats and pits
  • Kingdom: A clone of Hammurabi.
  • Lunar Lander: A Lunar Lander clone, where the player chooses gravity, atmosphere, and wind speed.
  • Noughts and Crosses: A Tic-Tac-Toe game with options for a computer opponent.
title: Games Compendium

description:
Baccarat is a 1–3 player card game for the Dragon 32/64.

The object is to score nearest to 9 with two or three cards. Three decks of cards are shuffled together, with 10s and face cards ranked as 0. The players compete against the banker which offers a stake at the start of each hand, and one player can choose to accept this bank. The banker wins in a tie.
title: Baccarat

description:
Dragon Racer and Wasp Invasion are two arcade games for the Dragon 32/64.

In Dragon Racer, the player tries to drive a supercharged 4-gear racer as far as they can without crashing or blowing the engine. The player controls their gearing and car movement using the two joysticks. If their engine revs above 12,000 the engine explodes. The maximum speed indicator shows the advised maximum speed, which is changed during rain conditions. There are three levels of difficulty, and the player must dodge incoming cars.

In Wasp Invaders, the player controls their vessel from the bottom of the screen, firing vertically to shoot incoming wasp attackers. The wasps attempt to crash into the player to cost them a life. The player starts with four lives.
title: Dragon Racer and Wasp Invasion

description:
Fantasy Fight is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

As an enthusiastic but inexperienced and ill-equipped adventurer, the player has persuaded a powerful wizard to magically transport them to a fabled labyrinth. Within this mystical maze it is rumored that bags of gold lie around for the taking, and it is said that magical weapons and spell scrolls of enormous power are scattered about.

The player controls a small character that moves between rooms collecting treasures while avoiding a number of enemies. Points are awarded by defeating enemies and collecting bags of gold. The player starts with five lives, and their health is displayed by a sword at the bottom left of the screen. There are three different colors of keys which can be picked up to open appropriately colored doors. The player can also pick up spells and weapons which are used to defeat enemies.
title: Fantasy Fight

description:
Living Stone is a 1–2 player board game for the Dragon 32/64.

Played on a large board consisting of squares, triangles, and hexagons, the goal is to be the first player to place six stones at all six vertices of one of the seven hexagons on the board. At the start of the game, both players take turns placing 15 stones on the vertices of the board. If at any point in the game a player takes control of all points of a triangle or a square they can reposition one or two of their opponent's pieces respectively. After each player has placed all 15 stones, then players takes turns sliding one stone of their color along a line until a player forms a hexagon and wins.

There are 3 levels of computer opponent difficulty.
title: Living Stone

description:
Superbowl is an American football game for the Dragon 32/64.

Starting with the kickoff, the player controls the all-star running back Floyd, who tries to catch the ball and run the distance against the opposing Washington team.

The player moves their player left and right, trying to position themselves underneath the incoming football. After successfully catching the ball, the player tries to run the 100 yards down the field while avoiding opposing team players that run straight down the field. The player's score is based upon yards gained and touchdowns scored.
title: Superbowl

description:
Trace Race is a 1–2 player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Transported to the Trace Grid by the Master Control Program, the player is forced to take part in man and machine combat where only the brave survive.

A light cycle game played on a grid, each player controls a vehicle that leaves a long tail behind them. If either player hits the tail of a vehicle or the edge of the field it's game over. In 1-player games the player score is based upon how long their light cycle survives.
title: Trace Race

description:
Sixty Programs for the Dragon 32 is a series of type-in BASIC games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • ABM Command
  • Alien
  • Asset Stripper
  • Battleships
  • Bricklayer
  • Bulls and Cows
  • Buzzy Bee
  • Championship Boxing
  • Cheshire Cat
  • Chomper
  • Critical Path Analysis
  • Dambusters
  • Dam Eaters
  • Defend
  • Division One
  • Dog Fight
  • Drag Racer
  • Duel
  • Energy Field
  • Evolution One
  • Evolution Two
  • Evolution Three
  • Exocet
  • Fall Guy
  • Fives
  • Flying Bomb
  • Flying Geese
  • Galaxians
  • Giant Rats
  • Grand Prix
  • Hangman
  • Heli-Bomber
  • Horse Race
  • Invaders
  • Lunar Base Delta
  • Postman
  • Minelay
  • Moonlander
  • Morse Tutor
  • Mushroom Invasion
  • Newmarket
  • OXO
  • Pay Packets
  • Roots
  • Russian Numbers
  • Russian Roulette
  • Sheepdog Trials
  • Show Sign
  • Space Traffic
  • Stunt Cycle
  • Super Supremo
  • Swordsman
  • Tanx
  • Tug of War
  • Wordgram
  • Wordsum
  • XmasEve
title: Sixty Programs for the Dragon 32

description:
Snow Queen is a spelling/pattern recognition game based upon a story by Hans Christian Andersen. The player must help Kay to become free of the Snow Queen who has imprisoned him in her ice palace.

The player searches for letters hidden on the frozen enchanted lake by moving a blue window to highlight letters. The player has limited time to spell the word displayed on the screen. Ultimately, the goal is to spell 'Eternity' to escape the Snow Queen. If the player runs out of time, they are frozen by the Queen's stare. There are five levels of difficulty, which set word length. There is a total of 840 words.
title: Snow Queen

description:
Water of Life is a roleplaying game for the Dragon 32/64.

The far-off world of Valgorin is slowly being overtaken by the forces of evil, led by the Warlocks of the Eye. Standing against the Evil is the aging ruler of Valgorin, Great Onin. A great spell of everlasting sleep has been cast upon Onin, and although a mighty warrior, he will soon succumb to its power. The player controls Pendragon, from the race of Warlock Warriors, who has stood beside Onin for many eons. Onin must relearn the great magic words and obtain the Water of Life from the Eternal Castle.

The player moves across the land of Valgorin by selecting the cardinal directions. The player inventory and statistics can be reviewed. A map is available to track progress. As the player explores they gather items, gold, and other treasures. Negative events can lead to loss of items or health. Several special locations on the map can be visited, and current terrain is graphically displayed on the screen. The player encounters random combat, where each turn they can attack or cast spells. Death awaits if all health is lost.
title: Water of Life

description:
Stargate is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player's task, as defender of the stargate, is to prevent the fleet of alien ships from leaving the galaxy through the stargate displayed at the center of the screen. The player controls a single ship in the center of the screen that can fire in the four cardinal directions. Enemy ships appear and fire towards the player, who must quickly turn to shoot incoming enemy fire and vessels. The player starts with three ships, and a new ship is awarded every 10,000 points. The game becomes harder the further the player progresses. There are three levels of difficulty.
title: Stargate

description:
Willy's Revenge is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player guides Willy the caterpillar around the screen trying to eat all the characters that randomly appear on the screen. As Willy eats more enemies its tail grows longer, and Willy loses a life if it doubles back on its own tail or hits the edge of the garden. The player starts with 8 lives, and Willy moves faster as each level progresses.
title: Willy's Revenge

description:
Fairground Fantasy is a text adventure with additional arcade elements for the Dragon 32/64.

The young boy Ivor has gone missing at the fairground. The player must find and rescue him. Initially played as a simple text adventure, the player uses text commands to move about the fairground and pick up and use items to solve puzzles. The player starts their adventure with only 6 pence, and must make money and receive clues by besting arcade sequences involving the various fairground games. These include a roulette wheel, pulling objects from a barrel, and test of strength. Ali-Kebab's Magic Carpets will randomly transport the player around the fairground. It's game over if all money is lost.
title: Fairground Fantasy

description:
Pirate is a 1-player strategy game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a galleon with the goal of destroying every pirate ship in the area. The galleon moves by travelling 1–4 leagues per turn, and can travel in the cardinal directions. The seas are dotted with islands, harbors, enemy pirate ships, and Xs which represent the edge of the world.

Every turn the player can take a view from the crow's nest which shows the nearby 12 x 12 area, move their galleon, receive a report from their 1st mate on the status of their adventure, take a nearby view from the deck, fire their cannons, or rest. The ship status is represented by the number of men, cannonballs, guns left, and sails left. Ship resources can be replenished by maneuvering next to harbors. The player can fire in the cardinal directions, and must choose the distance to fire and how many cannons to use. Each cannon shot uses precious cannonballs. The ship can take damage on rough seas, running into islands, or taking fire from enemy ships. The player receives a final score based upon the success of their adventure.
title: Pirate

description:
Games Tape 1 is a compilation of games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Air Assault: Fly a helicopter across a cityscape trying to bomb buildings to clear a landing spot. The helicopter flies a bit lower each time crossing the city.
  • Atom Hunt: Deduce the location of hidden atoms in an 8 x 8 grid by firing lasers which can be deflected, reflected, or absorbed.
  • Execution: A hangman-style letter guessing game where the player faces a firing squad.
  • Hilo: Card game where the player must decide if the next drawn card will be higher or lower.
  • Interplanetary Trader: The player makes money over 300 days by trading between the six planets in the system.
  • Snail Pace: Bet on eight different racing snails
  • Wipeout: A 1–4 player game where the player must move a continuously elongating line around the screen to try to hit all the targets without hitting the line.
  • Wumpus Mansion: Search the maze for the wumpus while avoiding bats and pits.
title: Games Tape 1

description:
Albert and the Monsters is a 1–2 player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls Albert as he tries to eliminate all the monsters on the screen. Played on a series of platforms with randomly placed ladders between them, Albert can dig holes through the platforms to trap the monsters. When monsters are trapped, Albert can defeat them by hitting them on the head with his pickaxe.

If he leaves a blott trapped in a hole too long, it escapes, becomes a bogle, and moves faster than before. Larger monsters called stompers require two holes to defeat. The jumping psycho poses the greatest danger. Albert is armed with a paralytic gas which temporarily stuns the monsters, allowing Albert to escape. The player starts with three lives, and a life is lost when caught by a monster.
title: Albert and the Monsters

description:
Galactic Raiders is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a ship that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen and fires vertically forwards. Fleets of enemy ships swoop onto the screen and fire mercilessly towards the player. After all enemy ships have appeared, enemy vessels begin swooping towards the player firing multiple shots. The player starts with three lives, with the goal of clearing all enemy ships to enter the next more difficult stage. At the end of the game the player receives a score, a military rank, and lethality representing the percentage of their shots which successfully connected with an enemy.
title: Galactic Raiders

description:
Invaders is a 1–2 player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a spaceship at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally and fires vertically. A group of alien ships move as a group across the screen left to right and back, moving down slightly with each return trip. Three barricades provide protection from alien fire. The goal is to shoot all alien vessels before they reach the bottom of the screen. An alien UFO intermittently flies across the top of the screen for bonus points. The player starts with three lives and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Invaders

description:
Super Spy: A Modern History Simulation is an educational game with arcade elements for the Dragon 32/64.

Designed to teach British World War II history, the program consists mostly of short educational vignettes with follow-up questions. These questions are interspersed with arcade elements designed to entertain children as they learn. These include:

  • Assault Course: Side-scrolling game where the player must jump over or duck obstacles
  • Cipher Course: Unscramble words to stop a bomb from exploding
  • Parachute Course: The player must position a parachutist jumping from a plane on a target while avoiding trees
  • Shooting Course: Quickly position a crosshair over a shooting target before time runs out

Finally, the player can solve a secret mission using elements from all of these games.
title: Super Spy: A Modern History Simulation

description:
Deadwood is a 1–4 player board game for the Dragon 32/64.

Welcome to the Western town of Deadwood. Each player takes turns rolling a dice to move them around town. There are numerous businesses that the player can visit, and hotels and saloons can be purchased. Any other player who lands on these owned locations pays the player rent. Price of gold and cattle vary each turn, and these can be bought or sold at the gold or cattle dealer. The player can gamble if they land on the casino, and owe money if they land on pot luck, the taxman, general store, or trading post. If any player goes into a negative balance they are charged a 10% bank fee each turn. The time for each game is selected at the beginning, but this can be extended.
title: Deadwood

description:
Screaming Abdabs is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a small character who can move and jump between platforms. The player starts with five lives, and on each level the goal is to gather up all the food, and then reach the key that unlocks the next level. The player has limited oxygen, and if the oxygen meter at the top of the screen reaches 0 the player loses a life. The player faces a number of monsters, including angry television sets, screws, drinks, food, skulls, and other monsters. The player also faces a number of dangers including platforms that fall apart under the player, moving platforms, electrical traps, and the dangers of falling too far. There are 34 levels in total, and the player can try to face them in order or choose a level at random.

sample_screenshots.caption: A Difficult Trick at the End

title: Screaming Abdabs

description:
Swashbuckler is a 1–4 player game for the Dragon 32/64.

Each player controls their own ship, starting with three sailing men in harbor. The distance their ship can travel each turn is determined by the number of sailing men aboard. The galleon is controlled by selecting what direction to move on the compass. During the voyage the crew must remain fed. To engage in combat, the player must move their galleon on the same square as their enemy. The ship with the most fighting crew is the winner. Pieces of eight are used to buy crew and gamble at the islands. Food, men, and treasure can be purchased by visiting the different ports. Treasures and gold can be stored at the home port so it can't be plundered or lost. The player with the most treasure at the end of the game is the winner.
title: Swashbuckler

description:
Leapin' Lancelot is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls Lancelot as he tries to save the princess from the castle. Lancelot can move laterally and jump, and must cross a number of screens avoid dangers including spikes.
title: Leapin' Lancelot

description:
The Thirteenth Task is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

Hercules, the divine hero of classical times, has finished his twelve harsh labors from the ruler of the land Eurystheus. The thirteenth task is to prove the most difficult and dangerous of all: Hercules has been charged with the task of killing Hades, the ruler of the Underworld. During the quest Hercules must revisit some of the tasks he completed on his previous adventures.

A help feature is available to guide the player. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. The score feature tells the player how far in the game they have progressed, and a save/restore feature is available.
title: The Thirteenth Task

description:
Big Six is a compilation of games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Hangman: Try to spell the word shown with blanks. Miss too many letters, and the player is hung.
  • Spiders Maze: Steer a spider from one corner to the other of an ever-changing maze.
  • Star Wars: Control a crosshair and shoot down as many enemy fighters as possible in a limited time.
  • Supermind: Try to solve the special code of 6 different colors.
  • Surround: The player and computer control a snake with a progressively elongating tail. Force the opponent to crash into a wall or a tail.
title: Big Six

description:
Submarine Commander is 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a submarine from a 1st person perspective and tries to torpedo enemy vessels. The player's radar shows the location of enemy vessels, and the player can move left and right, move towards their target, dive, and surface. The player has limited fuel which is used for movement and deeper diving. As the player approaches an enemy vessel it appears on the horizon, and if they miss a torpedo they must dive to avoid return fire. The player must also avoid enemy planes, mines, and depth charges. The player can return to base at any time to replenish fuel. The final score is based upon enemy tonnage destroyed.
title: Submarine Commander

description:
Alien Oddessy is an adventure game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player has been stranded on an alien planet inhabited by humanoids. Because they cannot speak the language, the player has been made a slave. The player must escape from Baron Fonsurro's castle, find a landship willing to transport the player across the plains where they must find the entrance to the Caves of the Moon, find the player's stranded ship, and escape from the planet.

There are a total of six parts spread over two cassettes. In each part, the player must move a dot representing the player through a maze to reach the exit. The player encounters random dangers, some of which can lead to instant death. There are also math challenges and other guessing games which the player must defeat in order to safely pass each section.
title: Alien Oddessy

alternate_titles.title: The Golden Apples of the Sun

description:
Golden Apples of the Sun is an adventure game for the Dragon 32/64.

The Golden Apples of the Sun have been stolen, and the player has been tasked with finding them. Seven apples have been stolen, and hidden in the Salamander Caves, Werewolf Forest, Gryphon Plains, Mermaid Bay, the Zombie Tomb, Harpie Hill, and the Dwarf Halls. Each area consists of a map with marked dangerous areas. The player is represented by a dot which moves around the map. The location of the apples are unknown, and the player has random encounters, some of which result in instant death, others have challenges and puzzles which the player can potentially survive. These mostly consist of random number guessing games. The goal is the find the apple in all seven areas in a single game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Random Number Game to Avoid Death by Sea Serpent

title: Golden Apples of the Sun

description:
Interplanetary Trader is a space-themed trading game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player must travel between star systems buying and selling cargo for profit. There are 12 different types of cargo available at each destination, and the player has limited funds to pay for fuel, cargo, and transportation fees between star systems.

At each planet, the player must choose the acceleration and deceleration factor estimate while going to or from the surface. This involves choosing the number that is 1/25th the total thrust or retro required. If this is chosen incorrectly, there is a chance of instant destruction.

When star jumping between systems, the player must choose a route, which have different travel times, fuel requirements, and dangers. Each day of movement there is a chance of dangerous events, which typically require rolling a random number between 1–1000, requiring a specific score to escape safely.
title: Interplanetary Trader

description:
Mini Games is a collection of four short games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Blackjack: Try to beat the computer by getting closest to 21 by drawing cards.
  • Guess It: Try to guess a number in the allowed number of turns. Each guess is told if too high or too low.
  • Layers: A short game based upon chicken farming were the player tries to survive 12 months by purchasing hens and feed, and selling their eggs.
  • Math Test: Challenge 10 math problems of five different difficulties.
title: Mini Games

description:
Scanner 13 is an arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Legend tells how long ago biomechanical beings from space called Flutter Drones attacked Earth to feed upon men's flesh. After a long battle, the people of Earth were able to drive them back, but the planet and its great cities were destroyed. Earth's people built one great city with a defense system against the drones. A network of towers, each with a scanner designed to seek and eradicate drone packs and air mines with minimum risk to human life, were created. Centuries have passed and only Scanner 13 remains standing, but the drones have come again. The player has entered the final scanner to try to protect the city from the incoming alien menace using the remnants of ancient technology.

The player's goal is to scan the entire city for the enemy presence and hidden mines by moving left or right. The player can x-ray an entire city area at any time. If the scanner encounters a mine signal they must quickly hunt the air mine, and fire when discovered. If they hesitate the city is vaporized. If Flutter Drones are encountered, the player must quickly determine if they intend to attack, and then activate defence shields to protect the scanner. There are 3 levels of difficulty, and the player has minimal energy to finish their mission.
title: Scanner 13

description:
Stockmarket is a market trading game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player starts with £50,000 with the goal to amass £1,000,000. Shares are bought and sold in blocks of 100, and there are 44 shares over 11 industries to buy and sell. Random events of government action or end-of-year reports can change the value of individual companies or the economy as a whole. The player can only own 5000 shares of an individual company, and a price change occurs whenever a share is purchased or sold.
title: Stockmarket

description:
Surprise is a game of chance for the Dragon 32/64.

The player moves about a large 21 x 16 grid, where certain squares in white have randomized events. The goal is to reach the magic ring in the top left corner. White squares can either give the player an item, cause the player to lose items, or experience instant death. The player must gather all 7 items before reaching the ring and escaping to safety. These are: A magic spell to quiet the a dragon, a rope to cross the chasm, a sword to defeat the goblin guard, the key to the tower, the lamp to guide the way, the combination to the strongroom door, and the magic spell that will allow escape with the ring. If the player reaches the ring without all 7 items they cannot succeed.
title: Surprise: A Mystery Game

description:
Fill Up is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a small bugship living on Earth's outer defences. The player must fill in craters with their powerful filling gun, which will shoot out under pressure and destroy the invaders through the top craters. New Earthlings appear to shoot out new holes. The player moves laterally and can fill holes and shoot forwards. An elevator on the right side of the screen allows the player to move between three layers of craters. When all craters are filled the player can escape on their rocket to the right. The player starts with three lives.
title: Fill Up

description:
Bombs Away Basil! is a 1-player arcade game for the Dgragon 32/64.

Played on a 16 x 11 grid, Basil moves between squares trying to defuse 4 bombs before time runs out. Confounding this are spiders which rapidly move about and can take Basil's life. The squares Basil moves across become solid, and neither spiders nor Basil can cross these again. These can serve as safety barricades or obstacles. Basil can move off the top and sides of the screen to circle around to the other side, where the spiders can not. Basil can also horizontally shift the ground beneath him to brings items closer and rearrange squares. Fruit can be picked up for bonus points. The player starts with 3 lives, and gains bonus points for time remaining after finishing a stage. Progressively harder levels have more spiders.
title: Bombs Away Basil!

description:
Caverns of Chaos is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Deep underground on the planet Sagon, there lie the Caverns of Chaos. Our intrepid explorer, Starman Jones, sets out on his mission to negotiate the vast labyrinth collecting keys from each cave to open the secret door to the next cavern. Jones can move left, right, and jump between platforms. Some platforms serve as springboards, while others are slippery, forcing the player to keep moving. If Jones falls too far or touches an enemy, it's game over. There are a total of 20 levels to negotiate.
title: Caverns of Chaos

description:
Creepies / To Boldly Go is a collection of two separate gems, an arcade game and a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

In Creepies, the player controls a space ship at the bottom of the screen that attempts to shoot incoming alien vessels before they take damage. The ship moves laterally left and right at the bottom of the screen, and fires vertically upwards. The goal is to destroy all enemies each level, and the enemies faced become tougher with each new wave. The player starts with crawlers, but then must face mad moths, spiders, hover flies, tracker bats, super bugs, and eventually tarantulas, bombardier beetles and then scorpions. The player starts with three lives.

To Boldly Go is a text adventure where the player takes the role of the four main crew of the USS Enterprise: Admiral James T. Kirk, Captain Spock, Doctor McCoy, and Commander Montgomery Scott. The player can change between the characters at any time, and each character has specific abilities for different situations. Admiral Kirk has been tasked with visiting the outpost on Omicron 5 to investigate a small island with an unusual radiation signature. Starting aboard the Enterprise, the crew must explore the planet's surface. All commands are via VERB NOUN command, and there is a save/restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: To Boldly Go: Choose a Character
To Boldly Go: Only Kirk can Get Orders
To Boldly Go: The Photo Torpedo Firing Area
To Boldly Go: Aboard the Bridge

title: Creepies / To Boldly Go

description:
Guardian Angel is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Protection of the city is of prime importance. The player functions as its guardian angel, responsible for protecting it from incoming ships and bombs. The player can move their ship in all directions. A crosshair in front of the ship shows the position any potential fire will take. Incoming bombs fall from the sky, and the player must shoot them down before they reach the city, or the player loses a life. On higher levels additional enemy ships attack the player. The ship has limited fuel and ammo, and these can be replaced by landing on a refueling platform. This takes the player to an additional screen where they can move their ship laterally and accelerate, trying to make a smooth landing on the platform to replenish their supplies. The player starts with five lives, and it's game over if all are lost.
title: Guardian Angel

description:
Kung Fu - The Master is a 1-player martial arts game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player must rescue their captive girlfriend from numerous dangers. The player is a master of kung fu, and can move left and right, jump, duck, perform a foot sweep, punch, middle kick, or high kick.

The player combats trainees who attempt to strangle the player, men who throw knives, snakes, bombs, and fire-breathing dragons. If a trainee catches the player they must quickly move the joystick left and right to break their grip. The player has limited health and time to complete a level, and if the player loses five lives it's game over.
title: Kung Fu: The Master

description:
MacDougal's Last Stand is an arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Jamie MacDougal roams the Scottish Highlands in search of his clan's lost bagpipes. Also on the moors are two sasernacks disguised as computer nasties whose aim is to stop young Jamie.

Jamie must navigate the hedges, trying to find the 16 bagpipes hidden over 16 screens. The small red nasty will always head towards the player and shoot at them. They can be destroyed by the player's attack. The player can only attack horizontally, which uses up their limited attack power. Attack power can be replenished by gathering a bagpipe. The larger nasty moves in a set pattern and can not be destroyed. The player moves to the next levels by moving through the gaps in the hedgerows.
title: MacDougal's Last Stand

description:
Mission Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Disrupt enemy communications and defenses by continually bombing them. The player launches from a carrier and game play is from the top-down perspective. The plane can move left, right, climb, and descend. As the player climbs to higher altitude they are safer from enemy fire. At lower altitude the plane is more susceptible to enemy fire, but bombs dropped explode closer to the front of the plane. The player must avoid SAM missiles and automatic fire from planes. The player gains points for destroying enemy cargo ships, tanks, trains, aircraft, and trucks. The player has limited bombs, and can replenish at carrier ships.

There are 2 levels of difficulty: amateur and professional, and only professional level allows high scores.
title: Mission Attack

description:
Morbid Mansion is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Ten rooms in an old mansion must be navigated before coming face to face with the dreaded Morbid. In the first five screens, the player must move their avatar up and down platforms collecting keys and gold bars. Blue keys for blue doors and yellow keys for yellow doors. Five gold bars must be collected from the first five screens to bribe the guard to let the player past.

When the clock strikes 12 a ghost appears, who moves towards the player and attacks. The player can enter attack mode which opens up a sight that the player can aim and shoot the ghost. Bullets must be obtained from the chest on the first screen, and these can run out. The player can also run off the screen to escape the ghost. The player starts with 500 health points, and these can run out from ghost attacks.

Starting with screen five, the player can only jump straight up or fall down shafts. Seekers at the top and bottom of the screen can kill when they are level with the player in the shaft. The player must collect power podules, as these are needed to power the laser to defeat Morbid in the final screen. Morbid appears protected by a force field with a small gap. The player must hit Morbid through the gap four times to defeat him.
title: Morbid Mansion

description:
Mutant Wars Part I: Mutant Arena is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a small character who can move in the cardinal directions, but can only shoot left and right. On each level a number of monsters appear, and the player must try to navigate to the exit door. If a monster is shot they turn into a tomb stone, but soon revive as a ghost to chase the player. Ghosts can be stunned if shot, but not destroyed. The player loses a life if they hit a monster or a wall. Each level has more and faster moving monsters. There are 15 levels in total. The player starts with three lives.
title: Mutant Wars Part I: Mutant Arena

description:
Olympia is a 1-player sports game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player competes in five Olympic athletic events. In each competition the player can earn 1st, 2nd, or 3rd place. If the player does not reach the minimal qualifying score it's game over.

  • 100 Meter Sprint: Wait for the starter gun to fire, and hit the spacebar as rapidly as possible to complete the sprint in minimal time.
  • 110 Meter Hurdle: Wait for the gunner to fire, and then jump over five hurdles. Player must qualify on the first attempt.
  • Discus: Press the spacebar to start the discus spinning. Press and hold the shift key when facing in the right direction, and choose the angle of the throw.
  • High Jump: Run to the bar, and press the shift key to jump. The player gets three attempts to increase the bar height.
  • Long Jump: Run with the space bar, and hit the space key when close to the foul line. The player has three attempts to qualify.

After completing all five events, the player can challenge all five events with more difficult qualifying scores.
title: Olympia

description:
Perilous Pit is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Deep underground in the diamond mines roams the dreaded Orbis and friends, who are bent on stopping the attempts of Boris the Miner to fill his truck with diamonds. Boris can move laterally and jump between platforms. Moving platforms can only be entered from above. On each screen there are three diamonds that Boris must collect one at a time and bring to the rail truck at the top of the screen. When all three diamonds are collected, Boris moves to the next of four levels. The Orbis initially doesn't move, but when Boris jumps, it begins to chase him. The player can move off the edge of the wrap around screens. Boris starts with three lives.
title: Perilous Pit

description:
Sewer Rat / Raiders are two arcade games for the Dragon 32/64.

In Sewer Rat, the player tries to help Ratty escape from the demon-infested sewers. The player must guide Ratty to to the exit at the center of the screen, and there are 16 mazes in total.

Raiders is a text adventure. The professor left on his quest for the lost artifact, but has not returned for a long time. As Blake Bones, the player must locate the famous Golden Computer Chip. The professor has left hints for the player's adventure. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Sewer Rat / Raiders

description:
Space Trek / Reversi is a collection of two strategy games for the Dragon 32/64.

Reversi is played on an 8 x 8 board versus the computer. Each player takes turns placing one of two colored pieces on the board. The player gains any pieces on the board their opponent has between their two pieces. The player with the most pieces at the end of the game is the victor. There are four levels of computer difficulty. Commands are via entering column and row.

Space Trek is a Star Trek variant where the player is commander of the Federation flagship USS Dragon. The player must destroy all the Trojans in the galaxy in a given time. The player has control of the battle computer, navigation, range scanner, and shield energy control.

The battle computer automatically fires at enemy Trojans when the USS Dragon is correctly positioned against enemy vessels. Navigation involves warp drive, which allows movement between quadrants on a 10 x 10 grid, and impulse, which allows low speed travel within an individual quadrant. The range scanner allows detection of the contents of distant quads with a range up to seven. Shield controls allows movement of energy from reserves to shields. If shields drop to 0 the ship is destroyed. Star bases allow the player to recharge energy. Planets can be mined for dilithium crystals to recharge bases. Black holes take the player to another quadrant without the use of navigation.

There are four levels of difficulty, and the player can choose their mission from a randomized galaxy and number of enemy ships and time to complete their mission.
title: Space Trek / Reversi

description:
Star Defence is a 1–2 player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a spaceship that can move up and down, change direction, and accelerate. The ship is armed with a laser gun that shoots directly forwards, and a limited number of smart bombs which destroy all enemies on the screen. The play area scrolls and loops laterally. The goal is to shoot all enemy vessels in the level to progress to a more difficult challenge. The players each start with 3 lives, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Star Defence

description:
Starman Jones is a 1-player side-scrolling arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

After surviving their prior adventure in the Caverns of Chaos, the player has now reached the planet's surface. Starman Jones must now strap on his jetpack and fight for his life against hordes of aliens who dominate the planet's surface. The player can fly their jetpack in all directions, and fire horizontally forwards. The player has limited fuel, and can refuel by landing on their starting pad. The screen scrolls horizontally, and enemy locations are displayed on a map at the top of the screen. When all enemies are destroyed the player moves to a new level.
title: Starman Jones

description:
Temple of Doom is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Starman Jones has been entombed in an ancient temple five levels deep. Played from an isometric perspective, the player must navigate and move between a number of small rooms. On each level Jones must pick up the five keys which give access to the lower level. Ghostly hands point the way to the exit. Jones can pick up items by walking over them. Bats can be defeated with sword and shield, gas masks render chlorine safe, and the mirror repels the squelchy rubber headache. Jones loses strength by moving between different rooms and encountering dangers. Food will restore his health. If health falls to zero it's game over.
title: Temple of Doom

description:
The Wizard's Lair is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a wizard who must defeat the Demons of the Lair and return stolen artifacts to their sanctuary. There are four artifacts in total, and the player must collect all pieces of each artifact to complete them and return to the starting point. The wizard moves through a maze that scrolls in all directions, filled with monsters that move about. The player can shoot fireballs, but these drain their limited power, but can obtain wands that allow fireballs to be thrown without penalty. Touching monsters also drains health. Keys must be collected to open doors. It's game over if health falls to zero.
title: The Wizard's Lair

description:
Space Trek I is a science-fiction themed text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

Most of the crew of the Starship Endeavor have fallen ill with Rigellian fever. The only cure for this is an antitoxin distilled from Ryetalyn. However, only perfect, pure Ryetalyn will make a working antitoxin. Mr. Selvon has located a planet with Ryetalyn on in, Holberg. The landing party will consist of Captain Chrostopher James, Science Office Selvon, Doctor Michael Spears, and Engineer Hamish Mc'Crindle.

The player can explore the many decks and rooms of the Endeavor, as well as beam down to the surface of Holberg to explore and search for the Ryetalyn. All commands are via VERB NOUN commands, and the player can switch between the four members of the landing party at any time. Each member has unique skills, and must be used to solve specific puzzles. There is a save and restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: Doctor Spears in the Sick Bay

title: Space Trek I

description:
Space Trek II is a science-fiction themed text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

The crew has arrived at coordinates 10:20:8, and find the planet Foskirb with the first ever starship circling it. A scan reveals that the crew of this ship, the Adventurer, have all lost their minds.

The Endeavor is further trapped in a strange force emanating from the planet. The landing party must bring the crew back to their senses and free the Endeavor. The landing party will consist of Captain Chrostopher James, Science Office Selvon, Doctor Michael Spears, and Engineer Hamish Mc'Crindle.

The player can explore the many decks and rooms of the Endeavor, as well as beam down to the surface of Fiskirb to explore and search for the force field generator. All commands are via VERB NOUN commands, and the player can switch between the four members of the landing party at any time. Each member has unique skills, and must be used to solve specific puzzles. There is a save and restore feature.
title: Space Trek II

description:
Space Trek III is a science-fiction themed text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

The dimensional gate has opened, and the crew of the Endeavor, along with the ship itself, has been sucked through to another dimension. However, the landing party has been stranded on the surface as the transporter has failed.

The key to the dimensional gate has been shattered into pieces and each of the remaining starships has managed to find one. The nearest starship, Pharos, is now circling Mishma, where their captain has been imprisoned. The player must help the captain of the Endeavor rescue the Pharos and find the piece of the key. The party consists of Captain Chrostopher James, Science Office Selvon, Doctor Michael Spears, and Engineer Hamish Mc'Crindle.

The player can explore the many decks and rooms of the Endeavor, as well as beam down to the surface of Fiskirb to explore and search for the force field generator. All commands are via VERB NOUN commands, and the player can switch between the four members of the landing party at any time. Each member has unique skills, and must be used to solve specific puzzles. There is a save and restore feature.
title: Space Trek III

description:
The Immortal Strain is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

The player desires immortality, but to obtain it they must deal with the devil itself to find the reagents to make a magic potion. The player must search abandoned churches, dark caves, and a sea of fire to obtain the demonic rings, horns, and metal to make the potion at a pentacle of power.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is a save/restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: A Hand in a Sea of Fire

title: The Immortal Strain

description:
The Time Machine Search is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

The player was testing their newly completed time machine when a loud explosion splits the machine into its four main pieces. The player awakens in a different world without the time machine, and must search for the four pieces to return to their own world. The player has a detector embedded in their wrist which will buzz when they find the pieces, as they've been camouflaged as regular items.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is a save/restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Find Items in a Shed
I Find a Crate in a Warehouse

title: The Time Machine Search

description:
Slither is a 2-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Each player controls a continually elongating snake. The goal is to force the opponent to strike the tail of one of the snakes or the walls, thus gaining a point. The first player to 9 points is the winner.
title: Slither

description:
Halcón is a Zaxxon clone for the Dragon 32/64.

Played from an isometric perspective, the player controls a spaceship that moves laterally, up, and down, as it travels through a chasm. The player must avoid obstacles and enemy fire, while they shoot or avoid enemy rockets, gun turrets, electrical fields, and fuel depots. The player has limited fuel and shield power. Fuel can be picked up by shooting fuel depots. If shield reaches 0, it's game over.
title: Halcón

description:
Pirates Ahoy is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

The player's goal is to navigate through, and survive, a series of puzzles to locate first the sunken ship, and then the treasure inside. There are a total of seven treasures to collect, the location of five of which are randomized each game. The player can spend a total of 36 minutes in real time under water.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Pirates Ahoy

description:
Crazy Foota 2 is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

A table football simulation, the 11 players of each team stand lined up against the left and right edges of the screen. The player selects their player on the edge of the screen, and the selected player can only be moved horizontally to kick the ball. The ball can be collected by that player, which sticks to their foot. The ball is then kicked in the direction the joystick is facing. The game tracks high scores.
title: Crazy Foota 2

description:
Froglet is a 1-player Frogger clone for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a frog that moves in cardinal directions, trying to cross two busy highways with cars traveling in opposite directions. The roads are separated by a river with moving lily pads that the frog must hop across. There are six homes at the top of the screen that the player tries to position their frog into. The player starts with five lives, and the game restarts if all are used.
title: Froglet

description:
Keys of Roth is a 1-player adventure game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player seeks out the legendary Keys of Roth deep within the caverns. Gameplay is via multiple choice encounters interspersed with animated screens. The player has limited health, and gains or loses health by their choices and the results of combat. The player can pick up or lose items, and can check their inventory at any time. When encountering enemies, the player can kick, stab, or bash each round, and also chooses to cower, parry, block, or duck enemy attacks. There are five levels of difficulty which determine the strength of enemies encountered.
title: Keys of Roth

description:
Laser Racer is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a light cycle which leaves a long colored trail behind them. The racer must adventure deep within the depths of the computer to destroy the central processor while fighting against protecting laser racers. If the player strikes a wall or the tail of another racer they are destroyed. The player can move between multiple zones via gaps in the walls to challenge other racers.
title: Laser Racer

description:
Linkword is a 2–4 player word game for the Dragon 32/64.

A variant of the board game Scrabble, each player starts with seven letters with individual point values. The players take turns placing letters on the board to spell words which must link with other words already on the board. The opposing player can challenge the word if they don't think it's legitimate. If the player can not spell a word they may take a turn to exchange their letters. There are 2x and 3x letter squares and 2x and 3x word squares. The game finishes when no more words can be spelled with the remaining tiles, and the highest score wins.
title: Linkword

description:
Show Jump is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a horse and rider that tries to jump over a number of fences in a course. Played from a side perspective, the player can accelerate, decelerate, and jump. There are 9 levels of difficulty with different fence placement. On regular games the player receives 4 faults for each fence hit, and on tournament levels the game is over after a single fault.
title: Show Jump

description:
World Boxing is a 1-player arcade sports game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a boxer from a top-down position, and can move their boxer around the ring. The player can punch with their left or right hand, and tries to hit their opponent in the head, gaining 1 point for each hit. The game is divided into three 3-minute rounds. There are a total of 10 opponents to compete against.
title: World Boxing

description:
Hotel on Mayfair is a Monopoly-like board game for the Dragon 32/64.

2–6 players compete to take ownership of the game board. Players take turns rolling two dice to move around the board. When landing on a property players bid for ownership. Players can improve their property by building housing or hotels, and can claim rent when an opponent lands on the square. Properties can be mortgaged off or traded, and improvements can be sold off if needed. Other bonus squares can reward or cost the player money.
title: Hotel on Mayfair

description:
Megamaze is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player moves a character resembling Pac-Man around a maze that scrolls and wraps around in all directions. A map shows the location of all items in the maze, and the goal is to eat everything that runs away from the player or doesn't move. The player has a limited time to eat all items in the maze to progress to a more difficult challenge with more and more difficult things to eat.
title: Megamaze

description:
Cat'n'Mouse and Spacemaze are two arcade games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Cat'n'Mouse: The player controls a mouse as it attempts to eat all the cheese while avoiding the cat that moves randomly throughout the maze. The player can escape the cat by moving through holes in the walls, but these can be only travelled once. If the mouse collects all cheese on a level it goes to a maze with a faster moving cat.

  • Spacemaze: The player is shown the map of a maze, and then must move from the entrance to the exit in the first person perspective. Doors allow more rapid movement through the maze.
title: Cat'n'Mouse and Spacemaze

description:
Circus Adventure is an adventure game for young children.

The goal is get to the popcorn stand at the circus in as few turns as possible. Each location has two possible directions to travel, and are graphically displayed on the screen with music. Some areas allow the player to pick up items. All movements are by pressing a single key.
title: Circus Adventure

description:
Dragon Selection One is a compilation of games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Brain Ache: Guess the correct series of letters or directions. The player is given clues to their mistake, and loses points each try. The player starts with 1000 points, and must solve the puzzle before running out of points.
  • Race Track: 1 –4 players bid on eight horses with differing odds, and bid for the win or even. The horses are shown racing on a track to determine winners.
  • Row of Four: Two players take turns dropping pieces into a board from above trying to make a row of four. Pieces fall until they hit the bottom or the piece below them. The row can be horizontal, vertical, or diagonal. The board is 7 x 6.
  • Simon Says: Repeat a pattern of notes 1–20. Each time the pattern gets longer, up to 20 in total.
title: Dragon Selection One

description:
Dragon Selection 2 contains several database programs, as well as a game for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Beat the Dragon: A hangman game, where the player must guess a word by guessing letters. Each wrong letter causes a piece of a dragon to appear, and the player must solve the puzzle before the dragon is complete.
title: Dragon Selection 2

description:
Dragon Selection Three is a compilation of games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Aliens
  • Detective
  • Hangram
  • Monty
title: Dragon Selection Three

description:
Dragon Selection Four is a compilation of two games and a musical composition program for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Lucky Dip: 1–4 players compete trying to solve the most multiple choice questions in a limited period of time. Questions are picked by choosing the letters A–Z.
  • Password: A hangman game, where the player can choose from 10 different topics. The player can score 10 wrong answers before the hangman is complete. The player starts with a score of 50, and loses three points for incorrect letters and gains five points for correct letters.

sample_screenshots.caption: Lucky Dip: Which is a Noun
Lucky Dip: That's an Easy One

title: Dragon Selection Four

description:
Eno / Stalag are text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

In Eno, the player's eccentric aunt has just died and left the player her estate. She had millions. If the player finds it they can keep it. The only clue: living room. The player explores the rooms within his aunt's house looking for the treasure.

In Stalag, the player is alone in a Nazi prison camp, the year 1944. The Germans have moved all the other prisoners to a new camp as they know it is only a matter of hours until it is bombed by the Allies. They locked the gate and abandoned the camp, but the player was forgotten because they had been locked in the hot box. The player must escape the camp alive.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. All available directions are displayed on the screen. There is no save or restore feature.
title: Eno / Stalag

description:
Breakout / Middle Kingdom are two games packaged together for the Dragon 32/64.

Breakout is an arcade game where the player controls a horizontally moving paddle at the bottom of the screen, and attempts to bounce a ball to destroy bricks at the top of the screen.

In Middle Kingdom, the player explores a series of caverns in the catacomb, temple, and pyramid to collect the three rings and return them to the starting sanctuary. The player can choose from the classes warrior, merchant, or magician, and there are 3 levels of difficulty. The player can choose a variety of weapons and magic spells to use from a menu in combat, and gains experience with each successful battle. Strength represents the player's remaining hit points.
title: Breakout / Middle Kingdom

description:
Poseidon Adventure is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

The player is aboard the luxury liner S. S. Poseidon. A huge undersea earthquake has caused a tidal wave which has capsized the ship. It is floating bottom-up on the surface and taking on water. Your goal is simply to get out alive. The player has a limited number of turns to escape the sinking ship before it goes down based upon difficulty level.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is no save/restore feature.
title: Poseidon Adventure

description:
Shuttlezap is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player's goal is to safely launch their shuttle from an underground silo up into Earth orbit, collect the satellites, and return them to the landing site. The ship is navigated by moving the joystick in the opposite direction of desired movement and applying thrust. Game play is divided into separate launching and high-orbit sequences. Ship movement is limited by available fuel. Game difficulty is adjustable by amount of time and fuel to complete the mission. Once in orbit, satellites can be neutralized by shooting them with the ship's laser. If the player strikes the ground during the launching process or is shot down by a satellite, it's game over.
title: Shuttlezap

description:
Diamond Manor is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

The player is a cat burglar who attempts to steal a black diamond from a mysterious impenetrable manor. The player explores the area around and inside the manor. The player must watch out for the gardener who can pinch items or even imprison the player.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Diamond Manor

description:
Don't Squeal! is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

The player takes on the role of the tough talking, hard-drinking private detective The Condor. They've been employed by a former drug runner whose daughter was kidnapped by his old boss because he wouldn't complete one last job. The player must find the kidnapped girl and bring her back to safety.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is a save/restore feature
title: Don't Squeal!

description:
Hole is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

The year is 2208, and the player is the sole crew member of a medium-range starship. Their mission is to visit a sector of space previously explored only by the starship Zelda. As the player enters the sector, they find themselves losing consiousness. The player now wakes up in some strange galaxy interlinked by a series of black holes. The player can travel to a series of different worlds useing their ship's navigation system. Each system has unique environmental conditions that require wearing specific suits.

There is a save and restore feature. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Hole

description:
Journey to the Center of Phobos is an adventure and arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Having committed several interplanetary crimes, Dr. Bugeyes has been thrown into a solar prison dug out of the asteroid Ceres. He is now holding the entire solar system ransom with a gravity bomb that, if allowed to go off, will draw matter into itself until it becomes the gravitational center of the solar system.

The player starts in an arcade sequence, where they must land on one of the four landing pads in the space scene. If they run out of fuel, it's game over. After landing, the player must explore the underground tunnels. These are explored by moving up, down, and in the four cardinal directions. The player's progress is hampered by robots and the corrosive elements, and the player has limited oxygen and energy for their travels. After reaching the center of Phobos, the player must defuse the gravity bomb by deciphering the code word. The player must then reach their spaceship at their original landing point to escape to safety.
title: Journey to the Centre of Phobos

description:
Pyradventure is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

After a long taxi ride, the player finds themselves at a remote shop. Their goal is to adventure into the last unexplored pyramid in Egypt and retrieve the death mask of the father of Tutankhamun, Amenophis III. Numerous dangers will send the unwary player to their death during their adventure. The player must also discover many other treasures including the gold and silver that were hidden in the pyramid, and return them to the taxi stop, and bring them back to Cairo.

There is a save/restore feature, and all commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Pyradventure

description:
Dragon Computer Scrabble is a 1–4 player computer adaption of the board game for the Dragon 32/64.

A variant of the board game Scrabble, each player starts with seven letters with individual point values. The players take turns placing a total of 93 letters on the board to spell words which must link with other words already on the board. The opposing player can challenge the word if they don't think it's legitimate. If the player can not spell a word they may take a turn to exchange their letters. There are 2x and 3x letter squares and 2x and 3x word squares. The game finishes when no more words can be spelled with the remaining tiles, and the highest score wins.
title: Dragon Computer Scrabble

description:
Spellbox is an educational game for the Dragon 32/64.

A word or math equation is displayed on a conveyor belt, and the player has a limited time period to state whether the equation is right or wrong. If the player is too slow or answers correctly the problem is destroyed by a laser. There are 5 questions per game, and correct answers are rewarded with a happy television while incorrect answers receive a broken one. There are 6 levels of difficulty, and the player can choose math or spelling problems.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Received a Broken TV Set

title: Spellbox

description:
Mazerace is a 1-player educational game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player navigates a small maze gathering letters or numbers. The goal is to complete the math equation or spell the object pictured.
title: Mazerace

description:
Underbeings of Croth is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

After discovering the entrance to an underground village, the player has been captured by its guardians. The player is now locked in an iron cage, suspended by a chain above a dark pit. The player is tasked with escaping the underground city to freedom. The layer explores labyrinths, dangerous passageways, and old caves.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is a save and restore feature.
title: Underbeings of Croth

description:
Exploring Adventures on the Dragon contains three separate text adventure games for the Dragon 32/64.

All adventures are played via VERB NOUN entry, and have a save/restore feature.

  • Castlemaze Adventure: The player explores an old castle and the surrounding countryside. They must avoid deadly knights, sorcerers, and spiders. The player must collect all the treasures and escape alive.

  • Tunnel Adventure: The player explores deep underground in magical caves, watching out for poisonous snakes and fierce animals. Their goal is to find all the treasure and escape alive.

  • Underground Adventure: The player is trapped in a deep underground cavern, searching for the only key to escape. The player must avoid gargoyles throwing knives, thieves that steal belongings, and poisonous insects.

sample_screenshots.caption: Tunnel: The Black Knight is Deceased Already

title: Exploring Adventures on the Dragon

description:
Dragon Digits Mathpack One is four educational math games for the Dragon 32/64.
