  • Formuline: A tic-tac-toe variant, where each space has a 2-digit number. 1-digit numbers slowly appear on the screen, and when a player thinks they can use those numbers to add, subtract, multiply, or divide to reach one of the answers they can ring in to claim the space.
  • Lander: Attempt to land a spacecraft on the planet's surface. Each turn the player gives the amount of thrust to apply, and the current velocity and altitude of the vessel is displayed.
  • Reversal: Try to rearrange the numbers 1 - 9 so that they are in ascending order. Each turn the player selects how many digits they want to reverse the order of.
  • What Next: Complete number sequences
title: Dragon Digits Mathpack One

description:
Maths-Trek is an educational, science fiction-themed math game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player's goal is to work their way up from second officer to general. The player must carefully control their energy and warp speed to return to base. The player must also defeat asteroids, black holes, and Klingon cruisers. When any of these dangers appear, the player must quickly answer math questions to safely bypass the danger. If the ship's damage level reaches critical, the ship will break up and explode. If the player successfully reaches a starbase then their success will be recognized and a promotion might be issued. There are 50 levels of game difficulty.
title: Maths-Trek

description:
Midas Maze is a puzzle game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player explores a single screen maze trying to find the treasure to carry it to the exit point. Multiple treasure sites are displayed on the screen, but only one contains treasure while the others are fool's gold. The player must explore treasure sites until they find the treasure. Every move costs a point; the player can also transport randomly on the screen at a cost of 5 moves. The player starts with 100 moves, and it's game over if they run out.

As the player explores they encounter random events like holes which cost 5 moves, magic holes which award 5 moves, black holes which randomly transport the player, and Fairy Nuff who rewards multiple moves. The player can also fall into a dungeon where they explore potential exit points, but might get eaten by a Red Devil.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Fell in to a Dungeon

title: Midas Maze

description:
The Crystal Chalice of Quorom is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

The Dark Forces of Klartz were held at bay from Quorom by the power of the Crystal Chalice, but when the dark forces broke through, the Chalice was shattered. Now its fragments are scattered to the four corners of the Kingdom. Darkness reigns supreme, and the thorn-spiked Tanglewood has overgrown the Meadowplain.

As an Apprentice Adventurer of the Second Order, the player has been selected to quest for the lost shards of the Chalice and, through death and danger, to return them to the Palace. Only then will peace and light return to the stricken Kingdom.

The player is randomly attacked by a wolfhound during their adventure which can kill the player, sending them back to the starting area. The player can then pick up their items again from the location they died. The player explores the Klartz, old cottages, and dangerous caves.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is a save/restore feature.
title: The Crystal Chalice of Quorum

description:
The Temple of Zoren is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

Terran security classed it as a suicide mission, and they chose the player to carry it out. Now, after fighting their way through the Zoreen guard-ships, out of fuel and with a damaged computer, the player's survival prospects look even slimmer. With Guard Robots and Secret Police ringing the outworld capital, even penetrating the Ringwall will be bad enough. Only agent 6809 would stand a chance, but, with the shipboard Reincarnation Unit on the blink, even survival looks questionable.

The player must bring back the Golden Orb, a map of Zoren, and a sample of the latest Zoreen Laser Gun to their transporter, as well as fuel to make the return journey. There are short arcade sequences involving landing the transporter. There are several instant-death situations, but the player has limited resurrections available. The locations of items are randomized.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is a save/restore feature.
title: The Temple of Zoren

description:
Treasure Tombe is a adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

Although the castle on Glastenbury Mound has long since crumbled to dust, the vast dungeon complex below, created by Arthur's mentor Merlin, remains intact. Before his death, the mighty Wizard placed his treasure in the 90 great vaults, conjuring up 48 members of dungeon spawn to stand guard throughout eternity.

The player moves their small character between rooms. The player starts with 20,000 health, and all moves and waiting causes health to drain. As the player moves between rooms they are attacked by monsters, who require a specific amount of energy to defeat. Health can be restored by the potions Merlin left scattered about the maze. Items can be picked up, and must be brought back to the starting room. Only a few of the 48 items can be carried at a time. The player can find sword and shield to assist in combat. Bombs will instantly destroy an enemy. Warps allow the player to randomly travel through the dungeon, and tunnels allow one-way travel to a different room. Victory is achieved by bringing all 32 treasures back to the starting room.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Have my Torch and Sword

title: Treasure Tombe

description:
Trivial Crosswords is a 1–4 player crossword game for the Dragon 32/64.

There are a total of 15 crosswords with over 4,000 clues in total. Clues and blanks are displayed directly on the screen.
title: Trivial Crosswords

description:
The Knife of Kishtu is an adventure game with roleplaying elements for the Dragon 32/64.

Along the border of the wastelands, situated in the northern hemisphere of Old-Earth, lies the small kingdom of Tyan. Once Tyan enjoyed a warm climate and the land was fertile. Over the last few years the winters have grown longer and the crops have failed. Strange creatures have been reported straying into Tyan from the north.

At this time, the trickster god Loki captured the King's daughter Lovilia, and took her back to his Citadel of Ice. The King, beside himself with grief, commisioned Kishtu, the most powerful wizard in the land, to return his daughter. Kishtu found Lovilia's soul locked in a shard of ice suspended from a golden thread within the Citadel. Kishtu forged a magical knife to cut the thread, but was destroyed by Loki before it could be used.

Now, the player has been tasked to finish Kishtu's quest. They must enter the Citadel of Ice, locate the Knife of Kishtu and his four magic rings, and release Lovilia's soul.

The player creates 1–5 characters with individual strength, wisdom, dexterity, and charm, which effect the actions they can complete. Characters have limited life points and carrying capacity. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: The Knife of Kishtu

description:
Alien Blitz is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a small alien vessel that moves back and forth horizontally across the screen, moving down slightly after each trip across. The spaceship flies above skyscrapers, and can drop bombs to reduce the height of buildings. Only 1 bomb can be present on the screen at a time. On higher difficulty wayward bombs leave craters in the ground preventing landing. The goal is to create a landing area for the vessel that allows it to safely touch down. The player can cause the ship to rapidly decrease altitude at any time, and has limited fuel.
title: Alien Blitz

description:
Fun Maths I is a compilation of math games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Chemist: The player must neutralize an acid by applying the correct amount of base given the provided ratio.
  • Find the Dragon: Try to find the hidden dragon on a 10 x 10 grid. After each guess the player is shown the direction of the dragon.
  • Math Maze: The player travels through a simple maze, and must correctly answer math questions or be sent back to the starting point. There are five levels of difficulty.
  • Number Race: Two players move their colored block around a field full of numbers. New numbers constantly appear on the screen. The goal is to be the first player to reach 100 without going over. If a player goes over they restart at 0. A computer opponent is available.
title: Fun Maths I

description:
Funwords is a series of educational word games for the Dragon 32/64.

Contains the programs:

  • Cracker
  • Word Square
  • Anagrams
  • Tiles
title: Funwords

description:
Games Pack I is a compilation of four games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Sheepdog: The player controls a sheepdog, and tries to lead three sheep into the pen. When all are corralled, the player can close the gate.
  • Snake: Control a snake to eat food. Every time the snake eats its tail gets longer. It's game over if the snake hits the walls or eats its own tail. There are three levels of difficulty.
  • Space War: Two players face off in opposite corners of the the screen, while planets populate the space in between. Planets have gravity which deflect shots. The player must select the direction and velocity of their shot to try to hit their enemy.
  • Torpedo: The player has 10 torpedoes to try to hit ships that float across the screen. The player receives maximum points if they hit a ship in the middle. There are two levels of difficulty.
title: Games Pack I

description:
Games Pack II is a compilation of games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Hangman: The player tries to guess a word from a number of blanks. If the player makes 10 wrong guesses they are hung.
  • Landing: Simulation of landing a small passenger aircraft on a runway. Divided into approach, landing, and stopping. The player controls throttle, break, and angle. Speed, height, distance, and wind direction are displayed.
  • Sea Battle: The player has a limited number of shots to hit all enemy vessels on a 10 x 10 board. There are five levels of difficulty with a differing number of shots.
  • Speedboat: The player controls a speedboat which moves left and right as a river scrolls vertically. The player has three lives or two minutes to collect as many points as possible. The ship has three speeds, and the player loses a life if they hit the river edge.
title: Games Pack II

description:
Games Pack III is a collection of two board/card games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Pontoon: A version of the card game blackjack. Two players and the computer draw up to five cards trying to get as close to 21 without going over. If the player goes over they lose, but if they beat the computer's hand they win. The player sets their bet each round. Five cards win double. Two cards adding to 21 exactly wins 1.5x.
  • Reversi: Player and computer take turns placing tokens on an 8 x 8 board. A player is X or O, and each piece must be played so that their is an opposing letter between their square and a piece already played. The player receives all pieces between their two tokens. The player with the most tokens when no plays are left is the victor. There are five levels to the computer opponent.
title: Games Pack III

description:
Games Pack IV is a series of 2 arcade games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Sub Chase: The player controls a battleship that moves left/right at the top of the screen, and drops depth charges towards submarines that move across the bottom of the screen. There are four levels of game difficulty.

  • Sea Harrier: A landing ship repeatedly sails from the right to the left at the bottom of the screen. The player controls a plane that moves from the left to the right of the screen, and moves down one level each trip across. The ship uses a unit of fuel each trip across the screen. The plane can climb or descend, and uses a unit of fuel to climb. The plane can come in contact nine clouds without being destroyed. The player can bomb the clouds with chemicals that disperse the clouds, but has the effect of shrinking the landing ship. There are four levels of difficulty.
title: Games Pack IV

description:
Larkspur Waldorf is Trapped! is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64, and the first adventure in the The Larkspur Trilogy.

Luckless Larkspur Waldorf is trapped inside a deserted castle on a high rocky outcrop. The player must help him escape.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Larkspur Waldorf is Trapped!

description:
Larkspur Waldorf: The Journey Home is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64, and the second part of the Larkspur Trilogy.

Larkspur Waldorf has escaped from a castle, and now must find his way home. All he knows is that his city is somewhere to the west, past a forest and some highlands.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Larkspur Waldorf: The Journey Home

description:
Lord of the Dragons is an adventure game for the Dragon 32/64.

Deep in the ancient forest of Zorg is a six-floor dungeon said to be full of strange treasure and fearsome monsters. In the bowels of the dungeon, guarded by the most powerful and terrifying of dragons, dwells the Evil Lord. The Tall Whisperers say that he prepares to set forth with many loathsome creatures to seize the fair lands in his dark and terrible power.

A party of five bold adventurers consisting of a warrior, amazon, cleric, hobbit, and sorcerer have joined forces to destroy the Evil Lord. Each level of the dungeon consists of interconnected rooms that might contain a treasure chest, a monster, stairs, or a food item. Previously explored rooms disappear unless the player discovers the Lamp of Daybright. In combat with a monster, the player selects a character to fight, and the results are displayed on the screen. Each character has individual hit points. Food items and treasure may benefit or harm the player when used.

Stairs allow the player to go up or down a level. On each floor lies one of the six sacred relics, which can be found in a treasure chest or by defeating a monster. They are: The Armour of Eternity, The Book of Dragons, The Cloak of Virtue, The Dagger of Fire, The Eye of Smaug, and the Flag of Purity.

After gathering all six items, the player can encounter and defeat the dragon which guards the Evil Lord, and end their scourge on the land.
title: Lord of the Dragons

description:
Copter Patrol is an arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a rescue helicopter that tries to bring stranded civilians in an enemy country back to the starting airfield. The helicopter moves in all directions and can shoot directly forwards, and it must avoid being shot down by enemy helicopters or hitting obects on the ground. Battleships appear at the bottom of the screen, and will shoot down the helicopter if the player lands near it. If the player lands by a civilian they will hop into the helicopter, and every civilian returned to safety scores points. The player starts with three lives, and loses a life when they run out of fuel or get shot down.
title: Copter Patrol

description:
Dragon Games Tape 2 is a series of three previously-released arcade games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Invaders: Control a ship at the bottom of the screen, and try to shoot the 35 space invaders that move horizontally across the screen. There are nine skill levels.
  • Lander: Try to land the space module on one of the two chosen sites.
  • Snakes: The player controls a character that moves about the bottom few lines of the screen and shoots vertically. Snakes approach from above, moving laterally across the screen and intermittently falling towards the player.
title: Dragon Games Tape 2

description:
Dragon Games Tape 4 is a compilation of arcade games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Hornets: The player controls a character at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally. Hornets emerge from a nest and fly circles. If hornets aren't destroyed quickly they swoop and fire towards the player. The player has three lives.
  • Pterodactyl: The player controls a small character that moves in all directions, and tries to shoot pterodactyl eggs. Eggs not destroyed quickly enough hatch, and begin to lay more eggs.
  • Torpedo Run: The player fires a total of 99 torpedoes from the bottom center of the screen, and tries to shoot ships that move laterally across the screen. Up to three torpedoes may be fired at a time.
title: Dragon Games Tape 4

description:
Droids is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The object of this game is to prevent the "DROIDS" from removing the lead shields and releasing the Trioxtron bombs which will destroy the Earth.

Three bombs sit at the top of the screen with numerous lead shields preventing them from falling to the bottom. Numerous DROIDS approach from the edges of the screen, trying to grab the lead shields and pull them to the edges of the screen. The droids fire towards the player, and if they're shot, the lead shield will fall down. If all three bombs fall to the bottom of the screen or the player is hit by enemy fire, it's game over.
title: Droids

description:
Maurice Minor is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Out for a quiet drive in their "Maurice Minor", the player inadvertently wanders onto a race track in the middle of a Grand Prix. To turn back against other cars would be suicide, so the player must put their foot down and make for the finish line and safety.

Played from the top-down perspective, a straight race track continuously scrolls from the right of the screen. The car frequently veers to the left. Fast moving cars approach from behind, and will strike the player if they drive too slowly. The player can further accelerate to pass the cars. Oil slicks make the car slide to the left or right. The vehicle has limited health: 10 hits and it's game over. The goal is to drive 10 miles without being destroyed. There are six levels of difficulty.
title: Maurice Minor

description:
Pogo-Jo is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Similar to the game Q*Bert, the player moves a bouncing spring on a series of platforms in an isometric perspective. The goal is to move onto each platform and turn them yellow. Orange springs appear at the top of the screen and bounce to the bottom. White springs bounce randomly about. The player starts with four lives, and loses a life if they fall off the platforms or touch a spring. There are 15 stages and fpur levels of difficulty.
title: Pogo-Jo

description:
Sky-Joust is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a knight atop a giant flying ostrich, trying to shoot down enemy knights as they appear on the play field. The ostrich can also walk slowly along flat platforms. The player can fire horizontally straight ahead, and enemy knights will quickly return fire if the player comes into firing range. Enemies continuously appear on the platforms on the stage and fly about. On higher levels, enemies move along platforms making it unsafe at the bottom of the screen. The player starts with four lives, and receives a new life and advances to a new level every 10,000 points.
title: Sky-Joust

description:
Taskship is a 1–2 player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a spaceship that moves in all directions as scenery tracks from the right of the screen. The ship can drop bombs on enemy infrastructure and fire a laser beam straight ahead. Enemy vessels, comets, and rocket launchers pose dangers to the player, as the player navigates cityscapes, underground tunnels, and other dangers. The player has limited fuel, and can pick up more by destroying enemy fuel depots. The player starts with four lives.

The program includes a scenario editor that allows the player to make and play their own levels by altering terrain and placing enemies. Scenarios can be saved for later use.
title: Taskship

description:
Yumping Yosser is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player's girl Daisy has been taken by evil monsters. After getting over the shock, the player races to the house where she is being held hostage. The player enters and sees the monsters doing their war dance.

The player must pass 15 stages of monsters. Yosser can move laterally on platforms, and jump to higher platforms, or drop a short distance. If Yosser falls too far, hits the bottom of a platform, or is eaten by a monster, he loses a life. The goal on each screen is to grab the key from the top left of the screen and make it to the door at the top right before time runs out.
title: Yumping Yosser

description:
Mandragore is a 1-player side-scrolling arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls Mandragore, a highly advanced exploration robot. During a routine investigation of an ancient pyramid, the robot inadvertently triggers the pyramid's self defense system.

A side-scrolling isometric game, the player can control the robot along the floor of the pyramid's hallways. The robot can fire directly forwards to defeat enemies, and must contend with lazer firing ants, mummies, ghosts, trapped eagles, and large mutant aardvarks. The player must also avoid ramballs and pyramids that can destroy the robot. On each floor the player must defeat a pyramid sentinel, which fires from the walls towards the player. The player must complete all five levels of the pyramid, and then contend with a second more difficult level.
title: Mandragore

description:
Avenger is a 1-player, science-fiction arcade game.

The player is the pilot of an Earth Defence Force fighter, which must be used to annihilate ships of the evil Pyrophyllian Empire using ammunition plundered from the enemy. The ship can move in all directions, and fires directly forwards. The game consists of three screens, two of which allow the player to gain ammunition, while the third lets the player use it. The difficulty level selects the number of lives the player starts with from 1–9.

On screen 1, the player must land on the munitions stores in green while avoiding the orange cross-shaped mines. Each successful landing gains 10 shots. Each object blasted scores a point, while hitting a mine loses a life. On screen 2, the player tries to blast all the enemies that come swooping in from the right of the screen. Each hit scores five points, while collisions cost a life and add 50 onto the timer. The object of screen 3 is to reach the top without colliding with an enemy. Getting there gains 250 points, and allows the player to access further stored ammunition. The player has the remaining time on the timer and up to three lives to reach the goal. When the player runs out of time, they are shot by a missile which can't be avoided. After every successful raid, the player restarts the three screens, but enemies move faster and the timers are reduced.
title: Avenger

description:
Onyton Quartet is a series of four text adventures for the Dragon 32.

These four adventures tell the story of a gnome family chronologically. All adventures are played via VERB NOUN entry to travel between locations and solve puzzles. Save and restore commands are available. In the adventures Gloria and The House that Dad Built, the player controls multiple characters, and must individually direct them.

  • Onyton: The player is an unemployed young man who just arrived in a small town. The player has to successfully perform eight tasks to become a solid citizen, or be thrown out of the town.
  • Gnome: A classical adventure for Dad by himself, in which a relationship between his family and the gnomes is established.
  • The House that Dad Built: Dad and Audrey are tired of the limited opportunities in Onyton, and go searching for a better place to live around Ghost Town.
  • Gloria: Tells the story of Dad's daughter Gloria, and how she becomes married.

sample_screenshots.caption: The House that Dad Built: Arrested for Theft

title: Onyton Quartet

description:
Harry Goes Banana's / Missile Commander are two arcade games packaged together for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Harry Goes Banana's: Help Harry pick the bananas which grow faster and faster, but watch out for the spiders.
  • Missile Commander: Defend the cities against impending destruction as missiles fall from the sky.
title: Harry Goes Banana's / Missile Commander

description:
Android Invaders is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player's task is to defend their planet from the invasion fleet of Zorg, who are using androids to spearhead the attack.

The player controls a small ship that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen and fires vertically upwards. Androids move as a group laterally across the screen until they reach the edge, move down a small amount, and then move back again. Androids intermittently fire back at the player, and as the androids get destroyed, the remaining ones begin to move faster. Four barriers provide protection from incoming fire. A green alien mothership intermittently moves across the top of the screen. If this crosses unscathed then the androids become invisible. Shooting a red mothership will make the androids visible again. Skill levels range from 1–8.
title: Android Invaders

description:
Picture Puzzles is a 1-player sliding block puzzle for the Dragon 32/64.

Each puzzle is 4 x 4 blocks. There are a total of 6 puzzle pictures spread over 2 tapes, and players can input their own pictures.
title: Picture Puzzles

description:
Castle Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Rush up and down the ladders testing every key to find the combination order to the castle lock. Avoid being destroyed by barrels of oil or struck by poisoned arrows. Once inside, crack the dungeon lock before the candle burns the rope that holds the sword above the maiden. Features two different levels of play.
title: Castle Attack

description:
Lachlan! is a fantasy adventure with roleplaying elements for the Dragon 32/64.

The player accepts the King's challenge and goes forth into the lands of the sorcerer Lachlan.

The player explores the overworld by moving through a fixed screen of mountain, forest, and open plain. The player randomly encounters combat or treasure during their exploration, and these locations are left marked on the map. If entering combat, the player combat strength is displayed on a horizontal bar, and a marker randomly appears on this. The player's goal is to press the button when the counter is in the right location to score a hit, or in turn receive damage.

As the player explores, they have limited food supplies that must be replenished. Food and healing can be purchased at the market. Spells can be purchased from the wizard's hut in the middle of the land, which can provide increased strength, escape from combat, or even armor. The final most expensive spell allows the player to enter combat with Lachlan the sorcerer.
title: Lachlan!

description:
Enter the Dragon is a collection of type-in games and programs for the Dragon 32/64.

  • 3-D Treasure Hunt: Try to find the treasure hidden in a 3D maze with an available map.
  • Adventure: A text adventure treasure search.
  • Alien Blitz: The player controls a ship at the bottom of the screen, and tries to shoot incoming alien vessels.
  • Black Jack: Up to two players compete against the computer in the game of blackjack. Players bet each round.
  • Bomber: Fire a ground battery at enemy bombers as they fly across the screen.
  • Bubble Sort: This program sorts a large list of numbers into numerical order.
  • Car Race: Direct a vehicle around a race track from a top-down perspective.
  • Chess: A player versus computer game of chess.
  • Chopper: Move the helicopter up and down, and try to fly over a city and destroy the enemy helicopters.
  • Dragon Clock: A simulation of a real-time clock.
  • Dragon Invaders: Try to shoot the incoming alien spaceships with a small vessel at the bottom of the screen.
  • Draughts: A single player game of draughts versus the computer.
  • Draw: A simple drawing program.
  • Eliminator: On a horizontally-scrolling screen, the player must shoot enemy vessels before they kidnap the humans.
  • Flight Simulator: Try to land the plane on the landing field. There is a top down section and a 3D landing component.
  • Guess: Try to guess the computer's three-digit number, and the player receives a clue that states how many numbers are correct and in the correct position.
  • Jackpot: Watch the wheels spin on a three-wheel slot machine.
  • Leapfrog: Try to move all the frogs on the left to the right and vice versa. Frogs cans only be moved to empty spots one or two spaces away.
  • Lunar Lander: Land a rocket on the moon surface without running out of fuel or crashing.
  • Meteor Storm: Control a space craft from a 1st person perspective to avoid incoming asteroids.
  • Number Scrunch: Re-arrange a scrambled group of numbers 1–9 by reversing a group of them.
  • Pinball: Two flippers at the bottom of the screen bounce a ball to score points.
  • Race Driver: Control a car that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen, and try to drive between incoming posts.
  • Random Numbers: Generates a random number and displays them in a chi-square.
  • React: Determines how fast the player can react by typing the number that appears on the screen.
  • Simulation: Simulation of Polynesian fishing fleets being blown to New Zealand.
  • Simultaneous Equations: Solves two simultaneous equations of the type ax + by + c = 0.
  • Space Pursuit: Line up the sights on 10 spaceships, and try to blast them before they escape.
  • Ten Pin Bowling: Try to knock down the 10 pins by rolling a bowling ball. The player must select the correct timing as the ball moves up and down.
  • The Talking Dragon: This program repeats back speech.
title: Enter the Dragon

description:
Enter the Dragon: Super Cassette A is a collection of games on tape from the book Enter the Dragon.

  • 3-D Treasure Hunt: Try to find the treasure hidden in a 3D maze with an available map.
  • Black Jack: Up to two players compete against the computer in the game of blackjack. Players bet each round.
  • Bomber: Fire a ground battery at enemy bombers as they fly across the screen.
  • Car Race: Direct a vehicle around a race track from a top-down perspective.
  • Chess: A player versus computer game of chess.
  • Chopper: Move the helicopter up and down, and try to fly over a city and destroy the enemy helicopters.
  • Dragon Clock: A simulation of a real-time clock.
  • Draw: A simple drawing program.
  • Flight Simulator: Try to land the plane on the landing field. There is a top-down section and a 3D landing component.
  • Guess: Try to guess the computer's three-digit number, and the player receives a clue that states how many numbers are correct and in the correct position.
  • Lunar Lander: Land a rocket on the moon surface without running out of fuel or crashing.
  • Pinball: Two flippers at the bottom of the screen bounce a ball to score points.
  • Simultaneous Equations: Solves two simultaneous equations of the type ax + by + c = 0.
  • Space Pursuit: Line up the sights on 10 spaceships, and try to blast them before they escape.
  • Ten Pin Bowling: Try to knock down the 10 pins by rolling a bowling ball. The player must select the correct timing as the ball moves up and down.
title: Enter the Dragon: Super Cassette A

description:
Castle Dracula is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

The player is travelling through a long forgotten valley in ancient Transylvania. A cold damp mist fills the bleak landscape. A wolf howls at the winter's moon. Ahead the player sees the sinister castle of Count Dracula.

The player must find their way into the castle, avoiding dangers including skeletons and Dracula's assistant Igor. The goal is to find and slay the Count.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. Unusually, examining objects and reading text is abbreviated to single letter commands which allow the player to examine all objects or read any text in an area. There is no save/restore feature.
title: Castle Dracula

description:
Death Valley is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

As the sole trader of rare minerals on Zilog, the player must defend the Triad freight-lifters carrying rare and precious minerals to the star ship Armada. However, the enemy Tamus has sent waves of mutant ants to ensure the player's destruction. The player must defend the lifters for twelve days and escape, or else be doomed to stay in Death Valley for eternity.

The player controls a single laser base at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally and fires vertically. The player must survive each day until the ship is ready to launch, and if five ants successfully reach the ship before time is up, then the player loses a life. Red ants increase the timer if hit. The player has a total of three laser bases.
title: Death Valley

description:
Backgammon is a 1–2 player backgammon game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player can compete against another human, a computer opponent, or two computer opponents can be pitted against each other. There are six levels of computer difficulty, and all movement is via keyboard commands.
title: Backgammon

description:
Program Pack 1 is a collection of games and programs for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Alphabetizer
  • Calorie Counter
  • Driveway
  • Flag Capture
  • Jack-o-Lantern
  • Mind Boggler
  • Sound Repeat
  • Tank Battle
  • Terrestial Adventure
title: Program Pack 1

description:
Program Pack 2 is a compilation of programs and games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Bartender
  • Calendar
  • Hangman
  • Killer Mansion
  • Life Expectancy
  • Racetrack
  • Robot War!
  • Slot Machine
title: Program Pack 2

description:
Program Pack 3 is a compilation of games and programs for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Basketball
  • Biorhythm
  • Bombardment
  • Business Letter
  • Blackjack
  • Frenzy
  • Quest for Lenore
  • Quick Think
  • Robot Bomber
title: Program Pack 3

description:
Program Pack 4 is a compilation of games and programs for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Advanced Pong
  • Checkbook Balancer
  • Convoy
  • Cyborg
  • Space Station
  • Spectra Sounds
  • Super Precision Division
  • Voice
title: Program Pack 4

description:
Program Pack 5 is a collection of games and programs for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Bag-It
  • Bowling
  • Conveyor Belt
  • Crown & Anchor
  • Destroy
  • Diffuse
  • Loony Lander
  • Sound Analyzer
  • Stock Market
title: Program Pack 5

description:
Space Fighter is a 1-player strategy arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player's mission is to take charge of the starship Endeavor, and destroy the aggressive fleet of Krugon Space Cruisers that have overrun the Universe. The ship is armed with 20 photon-guided missiles that can destroy any Krugon vessel, as well as Phasers and a number of starbases. The player moves their ship around a large space field that scrolls vertically and horizontally. The ship can rotate and move forwards. The player can dock with starbases to refuel and reenergize their vessel. Docking occurs from a 1st-person perspective. The player receives a performance index at the end of each game.
title: Space Fighter

description:
Dungeon Destiny is a text adventure game with graphics for the Dragon 32/64.

The player explores a large multi-leveled castle searching for items and keys. An image of the current location is displayed at the top right of the screen. Available directions are always shown. The player must search each area, as items are not initially displayed. As the player finds keys, new locations automatically appear in the castle. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Dungeon Destiny

description:
Misers' Dream is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Coins pour out of a money bag at the top left of the screen, and the player's goal is to direct the bouncing coins into the piggy bank. The player moves a small control hand on the screen that can be used to manipulate the movement direction of coins. Springs bounce coins around, and dollars fall from the sky and land on platforms, and if a coin hits a dollar sign it is destroyed. If a coin falls into the water at the bottom of the screen it is also destroyed. As coins are collected or destroyed, the coin counter at the bottom of the screen goes up or down. If the counter fills up before time runs out, then the player moves to the next level. If the counter hits 0 it's game over.
title: Misers' Dream

description:
Dragon Tamer is a hardware and software package that included a digital-to-analog converter so joysticks could be used with the Dragon 32/64. It came with two games:

  • Alphasquare: A sliding block puzzle where the player puts the letters of the alphabet in order. Puzzles range from 2 x 2 to 5 x 5.
  • Switchback: The player sorts a number of colored bars so they match the pattern shown below. A bar elongates at the bottom of the puzzle, and all pieces to the left of the bar are reversed each turn.
title: Dragon Tamer (included games)

description:
Islands Adventure is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

The player has become stranded on a small, desolate island. The goal is to survive by finding fresh water, food, shelter, and ultimately, escape from the island. The player's current thirst, hunger, and shelter are displayed. All available movements are displayed on the screen. The player can hold five items at a time, and inventory is displayed on the screen.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is no save/restore feature.
title: Islands Adventure

description:
The Fourth Dimension is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

Waking in the large Deep Sleep Center, the player must explore a giant disabled spaceship. The player encounters numerous dangers uncluding radiation leaks, defensive lasers, hidden bombs, and the ship's cat. The player can carry five items, which are displayed on the screen.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is no save/restore feature.
title: The Fourth Dimension

description:
Othello is a 1-player board game for the Dragon 32/64.

A 1-player game against two levels of AI opponent. Played on an 8 x 8 board, the keyboard is used to move a cursor to select playable squares. The player or computer can move first, and the players take turns adding colored stones. This switches all the opponent's stones positioned between the two pieces to the player's color. When the board is full the game ends and the player with the most stones wins.
title: Othello

description:
Jungle Search is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

The player has come to Africa in search of the legendary Elephants' Graveyard, and the priceless tusks of the Great White Elephant. Unfortunately their plane has crashed in the jungle, and they are the only survivor. The player must search the paths of the jungle for items to overcome its dangers. The player encounters quicksand, elephants, and other dangers during their quest, and can pick up and use a number of items.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is to save/restore option.
title: Jungle Search

description:
North-Sea Action is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls an oil drilling platform in the North Sea. The goal is to maneuver the pipeline to remove all the oil under the ground. Oil monsters move horizontally across the screen under the ground, and if they cross the pipeline the player loses a life. There can only be one monster per level on the screen at one time. If all the oil is collected, the player moves to the next puzzle challenge.
title: North-Sea Action

description:
Don't Panic contains two adventure games for the Dragon 32/64.

The Ice Kingdom: The player leaves their village and travels to the Black Mountains to the east in search of the Tome of Understanding. The player contends with cave bears, animate snowmen, and vicious ice dragons.

Towers of Death: There is an old legend, "When the Eagle-Man of Alabaster enters the Obsidian Towers, the evil curse will be lifted". The player's mentor has sent them to find the old sage of the woods, and to test the legend. The player must defeat the evil with the towers, contending with a vicious roc, sphinx, and other dangers.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is no save/restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: Towers of Death: I Found the Sage
Towers of Death: At the Entrance to the Towers
Towers of Death: Bad Lands of Tarrk
Towers of Death: Encountering the Green Man

title: Don't Panic

description:
Hang It is a 1- or 2-player hangman game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player attempts to guess a word from the number of blanks shown. Letters are guessed, and if incorrect the gallows and hangman are slowly drawn on the screen. Ten incorrect guesses, and it's game over. Previously selected letters are not displayed on the screen. In 2-player games, players can make custom words. Answers are primarily United Kingdom place names and sports teams.

sample_screenshots.caption: Brecon is Apparently a Small Town in Wales

title: Hang It!

description:
Lion Heart is a 1-player adventure game for the Dragon 32/64.

Gameplay is divided into two parts. In the first part, Richard the Lionheart is building his forces for the Third Crusade. His men are scattered throughout the forest of medieval England, and Prince John's army is tracking Richard down. Lettered squares on the screen represent Richard's men, while green areas represent thick forests. King John's men will constantly move towards the player, and will burn down any forest or men they encounter. The goal is to collect at least 450 men and escape out the bottom right of the screen. King John's men always start in the bottom right of the screen, and will reappear there after burning down 10 forest squares. If his men catch Richard, it's game over.

In the second part, the player explores the Holy Lands from a top-down perspective. The player has limited food and strength which are depleted with movement. The player can visit different sites marked on the map, which can increase the player's strength or food, or can offer puzzles which, if solved correctly,will strengthen Richard's party. The player also engages in combat with roving bands, and the party with the highest strength will win. Once the player is strong enough, they must attack Saladin's fortress, where they need a high power level to defeat the enemy. The player can run from most combats, but not the final battle. It's game over if strength falls to 0.
title: Lion Heart

description:
Astro Blast is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a spaceship that moves horizontally at the bottom of the screen, and fires vertically. Six columns of enemy ships descend and fire from above. Enemy ships can only be shot while descending. If an enemy ship reaches the bottom of the screen they temporarily prevent the player from moving beyond that point. If the player is hit by enemy fire, strikes a descending ship, or hits a stationary ship at the bottom of the screen they lose a life. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Astro Blast

description:
Photo Finish is a 1–4 player horse race gambling game for the Dragon 32/64.

Each player starts with $100, and can bet on the winner or ends of six horse races. The player then watches the horses race and sees a photo finish at the end. The race results and payout are shown after each race. Players are eliminated when they run out of money.
title: Photo Finish

description:
S·A·S is a 1-player arcade for the Dragon 32/64.

The player has seized vital documents from the enemy's headquarters after a daring raid. Unfortunately, the rescue helicopter was shot down, and the player is the only survivor. The player must reach Plato Bay by crossing nine minefields, while avoiding patrolling helicopter gunships and guards. The player starts with a mine detector and 10 percussion grenades.

Played from a top-down perspective, the player tries to cross the screen from the bottom to top. The mine detector will detect mines ahead, to the left, and right. Grenades can be used to knock out enemy bases, and these bases have wire-guided missiles to knock out patrolling helicopters. Extra grenades can be seized by passing through a minefield and surprising patrolling guards. There's a limited amount of daylight, and during night the player must maneuver using the metal detector and lights from the bases and patrolling guards.
title: S·A·S

description:
Death Mines of Sirus is a combination arcade and text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

The year is 2112, and the planet has been fighting the intergalactic wars for the past 70 years. Strontium 98, a rocket fuel vital for the war effort, is mined from the moons of Sirus, a star system discovered in the 21st Century. Originally the Humans had good relations with the Siruns, but it appears the Siruns are now negotiating with the enemies of Earth. The player has been selected to assist Captain Phoenix as he attempts to confirm or refute these reports.

The game is divided into two parts. First is an arcade component where the player controls a landing ship, and must safely land on the four landing pads on each screen while avoiding asteroids that move horizontally across the screen. After doing this, the player must return to the waiting command ship located at the top. The player must achieve a sufficiently high score to obtain the passcode for the text adventure.

In the first part of the text adventure component, the player's ship has been invaded by a deadly fungus. The player must seek help to defeat the invading fungus. All commands are via multiple choice, and the player must proceed through the adventure by choosing the correct gameplay options.

In the second part, the player has now entered the base on the surface of Sirus. In this sequence the player moves a small dot representing their character around schematic pictures of the base. The player can enter a number of different rooms, where they can interact with items and consoles.
title: Death Mines of Sirus

description:
If I had a Million is a combination board game and adventure game for the Dragon 32/64.

During the first sequence, the player participates in a board game similar to Monopoly, and must accumulate £20,000 to receive the passcode to access the adventure component of the game.

Having accumulated a set sum of money through buying and renting property, the player is given £1m by a businessman and six months in which to increase it to £5m through the stock market, property and business opportunities.
title: If I had a Million

description:
Mission Moonbase is a combination arcade and adventure game for the Dragon 32/64.

Having gone to Moonbase Archimedes to help stabilize Strontium 98 mined from the previous Death Mines of Sirus, the player discovers that the Moon transporter driver has been murdered.

In the arcade section, the player takes part in a sidescrolling mission with a moon buggy. The buggy can shoot vertically upwards, jump, and roll along the ground, speeding up and slowing down. The player must jump over mines and holes on the ground, while also avoiding or shooting down enemy spaceships that descend from the sky. The player must refuel by jumping into fueling blocks. As the player jumps, their vehicle's stability decreases, and too many jumps or hits from alien vseesls will cause the moon vehicle to explode. The player must pass a total of 40 zones to receive the password for the next section.

This allows the player to enter the text adventure component. In this section the player must solve the mystery of the moonbase where Strontium-98 is stabilized. All commands here are via VERB NOUN entry. During this section the player must also pilot a spaceship by typing commands, and engage in combat with dangers from the sky.
title: Mission Moonbase

description:
The Emperor Must Die is a combination arcade game and text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

The Galactic Emperor has become so corrupt that, throughout the inhabited planets of the Empire, underground movements have arisen. These movements are looking for someone who has the skill of a rocket pilot, the eagle eyes of a marksman gunner, and the sheer determination to accept the task of assassinating the Emperor. The player and Captain Phoenix must show they are up to the task.

In the first arcade section, the player controls a spaceship that moves laterally, and fires directly forwards. The player has limited fuel, and must survive enemy ships, space mines, and power barriers. The player must visit three of the first five planets to receive a password to start the first adventure.

In the text adventure component, the player has been tasked by the Central Computer to prove they are worthy to kill the Emperor. They are dropped in an unknown land, and must find the transporter disc to return. A map helps guide the player's movement on the planet's surface, and the player must scavenge for weapons to fight off attacking monsters. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.

By completing the adventure, the player is given a password to access further action sequences, which will ultimately provide the passcode to access the final adventure sequence.
title: The Emperor Must Die

description:
Jet Boot Colin is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls Colin, a young spaceman who must disarm bombs before they explode. Colin can use his jet boots to float high up in the air, and will slowly sink back to the ground when they are not engaged. Colin can move laterally between platforms, and must avoid enemies that bounce vertically up and down. If Colin is hit by an enemy or hits his head on certain platforms he loses a life. Bombs appear on platforms with a countdown timer displayed, and the player must reach them to disarm them before time expires. There are five levels of difficulty, and the player starts with three lives.
title: Jet Boot Colin

description:
Slide is a sliding block puzzle game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player slides blocks on a 6 x 7 sliding block puzzle to solve a decimal puzzle, hexidecimal puzzle, or a map of the United States. A solution is available to help the player.
title: Slide

description:
Toppler is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a shooter at the bottom of the screen that moves horizontally and fires vertically. Three rows of targets go scrolling by, containing tin men, rabbits, ducks, targets, and bonuses. The player starts each level with 45 bullets, and if a duck does off the edge of the screen on the third row five bullets are lost. If the player hits a bonus target, then all rabbits are turned to ducks, and the player loses their bonus score. The goal is to shoot all objects except for the bonuses. If the player runs out of bullets it's game over. Between rounds, the player shoots at Tommy Tank, which reverses direction on the screen whenever shot.
title: Toppler

description:
Robin Hood: An Adventure in Lincoln Green is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

The player must rescue Maid Marian from the Sheriff of Nottingham, and bring her to safety at the local church. Marian can be won by being victorious in an archery contest. The player explores the many locations in Sherwood Forest via text commands. Robin Hood's Merry Men randomly appear, and they can provide the player clues on how to complete their quest. The player also encounters random robbers, the Sheriff's men, and local bishops, and can fight, run away, or bribe their way out of these encounters. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is a save/restore feature.
title: Robin Hood: An Adventure in Lincoln Green

description:
Challenge/Number Matcher are two puzzle games for the Dragon 32/64.

Challenge: The player is shown up to seven diagrams of random dots and patterns. The player has a limited time to choose which one is different. There are four levels of difficulty, and the challenge becomes more difficult during play.

Number Matcher: The player must type a number based upon the expanded form, or write the expanded form based upon a number.
title: Challenge/Number Matcher

description:
Math Games Pack is a series of four educational games for the Dragon 32/64. Each game has four difficulty levels, and questions become more difficulty with correct answers.

  • Addictive Addition: The player is briefly shown an addition question, and must submit the correct answer.
  • Diabolical Division: Quickly solve the displayed division question and choose from several answers
  • Murderous Multiplication: Quickly count the dots in two boxes and multiply them together.
  • Sadistic Subtraction: The player is briefly shown several numbers to subtract from the larger displayed number.
title: Math Games Pack

description:
Oil Recovery is a 1–4 player strategy game for the Dragon 32/64.

Each player has a starting position on the 26 x 10 map, and for a cost can relocate to a different location. Oil patches appear on the grid, and the player must build pipes to drain the oil. It costs money to build pipes, and the player makes money for any oil recovered. Excess pipes can be sold off for scrap after oil patches are drained. The player with the most money at the end of a set number of turns is the winner.
title: Oil Recovery

description:
Super Fruit Machine is a 1-player casino game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player inserts a coin to spin a three-reel slot machine. After each spin, the player receives 0–5 nudges, which allows the movement of the reels a few positions to try to score points. Points are awarded with 3-in-a-row.
title: Super Fruit Machine

description:
Tank Battle is a 2-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

From a top-down perspective, each player controls a tank that can turn 360 degrees, accelerate forwards and backwards, and fire directly forwards. There are four different level designs, and the goal is to navigate around obstacles and shoot the opponent five times before receiving five hits.
title: Tank Battle

description:
Mubungly is a 1-player trading game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player arrives on a strange African island, where they must travel between villages trading coconuts, grass skirts, pearls, clay pots, shrunken heads, and axes. Each village has a different trading price and the player's goal is to make a profit. The player hires porters to carry items, and must ensure there's adequate food to feed them. The player has limited health, and can become injured or lose porters while travelling between villages. The witch doctor can help heal injuries for a price.
title: Mubungly

description:
Cecil Plays 21 is a 1-player card game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player competes against Cecil in the game of 21. The player bets $100 to $500 each game, and starts with two cards, and can take extra cards, either twisting another card or sticking to their current score. The goal is to get as close to 21 as possible without going over. The player doubles their money if they beat Cecil, triples it with a score of 21, and multiplies by 5 if they play five cards without going over 21.
title: Cecil Plays 21

description:
Craps & Roulette are two 1-player gambling games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Craps: Bid on the roll of two dice. 7 or 11 are natural winners tripling the bet. 2, 3, or 12 are craps, and the player loses 5x their bet. On all other rolls, the player keeps rolling until they hit their original roll, unless they hit 7 which is a loss. In this situation each roll costs $50 or $100 to quit early.
  • Roulette: The player starts with $100, and the house $10,000. The goal is to break the house. Each turn, the player is given odds, and can make 10 types of bets.
title: Craps & Roulette

description:
Zotoka is a 1-player strategy game for the Dragon 32/64.

While out in their boat, the player falls asleep, and soon awakens to find themselves on an uncharted island. Setting out to make it their own, the player finds themselves running the island, now christened Zotoka. The island is not easy to run. Food is needed all the time on the developing island. If people get restless then soldiers are called in to invade the island. If they set up more than two enemy bases, then the player is deposed. The island is also ripe for hurricanes, which can ruin all the player's work. The goal is the rule the island for 5 to 20 years. There are multiple skill levels, and the people must be provided with housing. There are numerous improvements for the island, including: hospitals, factories, fishing, housing, defensive bases, which are placed on a 10 x 10 grid. The player must also maintain a standing army to defend against invaders that can destroy the nation.
title: Zotoka

description:
Protector is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Somewhere on the edge of the galaxy lies a planet threatened with invasion of alien craft. The player is the sole defender of the human population, as they sweep the skies with their sensors to locate and destroy the aliens before they carry off the player's charges to who knows what fate.

The player controls a ship that moves in all directions, and fires directly forwards. As alien ships approach, they fire towards the player. Aliens ships try to swoop in and grab people positioned at the bottom of the screen, and the player must shoot them before the humans are lost. The ship is armed with three smart bombs which destroy all enemies on the screen. The ship can also hyper-warp to another location on the screen at any time. If the player is shot down three times, or all humans are lost, it's game over. The player moves to the next level when all aliens are destroyed.
title: Protector

description:
Flight Simulator is a flight simulation game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player is a passenger of a light aircraft on a normal domestic flight, when suddenly the pilot is taken ill. They are the only person left on the plane who has any chance at all of bringing it down safely. The player can choose to take the final landing approach, or full simulation where the player must navigate the plane to the landing site.

Played from a 1st-person perspective, the player must use their throttle and elevator to control speed and altitude. The aircraft has a maximum speed of 400 knots, and will stall below 130 knots. The player can control flaps to reduce stalling speed as they get within five miles of their destination, but if they go too fast at full flap or the landing gear engaged the plane will be damaged.

sample_screenshots.caption: Deployed Landing Gear at High Speed

title: Flight Simulator

description:
Variety Pack is a series of simple games for the Dragon 32/64.

Contains 25 programs to help realise the full potential of the Dragon.

  • Bandit
  • Calendar
  • Craps
  • Draw
  • Ducks
  • Fans
  • Fighters
  • Ghosts
  • Hangman
  • Letters
  • Lines
  • Mines
  • Monster
  • Music
  • Numbers
  • Perms
  • Primes
  • Puzzler
  • Reaction
  • Sort
  • Spacewar
  • Stars
  • Supermem
  • Trails
  • Triangle
title: Variety Pack

description: Missile Command is a Dragon 32/64 clone of the original arcade game Missile Command.
title: Missile Command

description:
MRC is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

An enemy spaceship appears on the screen and rapidly flies about. The ship also takes runs towards the player to return fire. The player tries to position a crosshair to shoot the incoming vessel. After a number of shots, the player must re-arm. They are unable to return fire during this sequence. If the player is shot three times it's game over.
title: MRC

description:
Pontoon is a 1-player card game versus the computer for the Dragon 32/64.

The player draws cards, with the goal of getting as close to 21 each game without going over. The player can bet up to $200 each game, and can double their money with a win. The player can stick, twist for another card, or burn at 14. If the player and computer tie, the computer wins.
title: Pontoon

description:
Dickie's Den is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

After winning the pools, Dickie decides to buy himself a mansion. His new dream home is old and in need of renovation. Unfortunately, the builders ran off with some of his money, claiming that they had seen ghosts. A wall needs to be finished, and the player must explore different rooms to collect wall segments. Dickie is vaporized if he touches a ghost, and starts with six lives. After collecting all of the pieces, the player must travel to the room with a safe to complete the mansion.

The player controls Dickie, who can walk and jump between platforms. The player must explore a number of different rooms to collect items. They must avoid dangers including stamping feet and moving candles.
title: Dickie's Den

description:
Dickie Spaceman is an arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Dickie is an interplanetary pirate who travels between planets to collect treasure. Played from a side perspective, Dickie can move in all directions and fire forwards, but is always pulled down by gravity when not using his thruster pack. The planets are inhabited by numerous aggressive species that will attack Dickie.

Every five levels, Dickie upgrades his spaceship, but as a result of steering, he will crash land on the next planet. On these levels the player must reassemble his spaceship before refueling. Items can be picked up, and are automatically dropped in place when the player flies above their landing site. After fully refueling their ship, the player has 30 seconds to reach the ship and safety. There are six levels of difficulty, and the player can start with 5 or 10 lives.
title: Dickie Spaceman

description:
Shaolin Master is a 1–2 player fighting game for the Dragon 32/64.

Two identical martial artists face off against each other. Each match is timed for 60 seconds and, after each hit is landed, the combatants separate and restart the fight. The players gain more points for more accurate hits. The player with the most points after 60 seconds is the winner. The fighters can jump, flip, and throw a variety of punches and kicks.
title: Shaolin Master

description:
Cod Creek is a rerelease of Swashbuckler: Each player controls their own ship, starting with three sailing men in a harbor. The distance their ship can travel each turn is determined by the number of sailing men aboard. The galleon is controlled by selecting what direction to move on the compass. During the voyage the crew must remain fed.

To engage in combat, the player must move their galleon on the same square as their enemy. The ship with the most fighting crew is the winner. Pieces of eight are used to buy crew and gamble at the islands. Food, men, and treasure can be purchased by visiting the different ports. Treasures and gold can be stored at the home port so it can't be plundered or lost. The player with the most treasure at the end of the game is the winner.

Tombstone is a re-release of Deadwood: Welcome to the Western town of Tombstone. Each player takes turns rolling a dice to move them around town. There are numerous businesses that the player can visit, and hotels and saloons can be purchased. Any other player who lands on these owned locations pays the player rent.

Price of gold and cattle vary each turn, and these can be bought or sold at the gold or cattle dealer. The player can gamble if they land on the casino, and owe money if they land on pot luck, the taxman, general store, or trading post. If any player goes into a negative balance they are charged a 10% bank fee each turn, The time for each game is selected at the beginning, but this can be extended.
title: Tombstone & Cod Creek

description:
Maze Runner is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The object of the game is to escape the maze before the air runs out. Once the player enters the maze, the only way out is through the door at the other end. The player uses control keys to turn, and ENTER to move forwards. The exit door is locked, and can only be opened by the remote control panel hidden somewhere in the maze. The panel is activated by walking up to it and cracking the colour code.
title: Maze Runner

description:
Burglary Adventure is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

Playing as a burglar, the player must enter various buildings throughout town to steal $20,000 worth of goods. These goods can be sold to the trader or the guard. The player collects items in their travels that can be used in further crimes, and must avoid being caught or their parole cost increases.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is a save/restore feature available. A help command can assist with difficult situations.
title: Burglary Adventure

description:
Convoy Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Game play is divided into two sections. First, the player must protect a naval convoy featuring a central aircraft carrier and outlying ships. Incoming enemy planes threaten the convoy, and if all outlying ships are destroyed, it's game over.

The player launches up to three aircraft that will continue travelling in a single direction until the player takes control to intercept a plane. The player can only control one of the three airborne craft at a time. Each plane has individual fuel.

If all enemies are destroyed, the player enters a second arcade component where they fly a plane from a top-down perspective that can turn left and right. The plane shoots forwards, and the player has three chances to destroy all enemy craft. Enemy ships, the player, and bullets scroll off the edge of the screen and appear on the other side. There are three levels of difficulty.
title: Convoy Attack

description:
White Crystal is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

On another world 10,000 years before mankind existed, there lived a race of gentle wizards known as the Karn. This world was rich with nature and enlightenment, the power for which came from the Great White Crystal. But, darkness came to the land in the form of the Scard Lord of Night. He transformed the crystal from white to black, and enslaved the world for 1,000 years. The player is the last of the Karn, and it is their quest to climb the tower, find the crystal sword, and strike the black crystal to free the land from Scard's power.

The player controls a wizard that moves laterally, and can climb up and down ladders. The goal is to climb higher in the tower. The Scard Lord appears randomly, and fires to the left and right. They must avoid other dangers including spiders. The player must pick up food, and if they run out of energy they will die. The player picks up a sword at the bottom of the tower, but this can only be used on the White Crystal. If the wizard gets hit, it's game over.
title: White Crystal

description:
North Sea Oil is a strategy game for the Dragon 32/64.

Dragon Delta is a semi-submersible oil rig in the North Sea. The player is the Offshore Installation Manager for the rig, and is responsible for coordinating rig activity to maximize oil production. The player controls a workforce of 200 men, and a weekly budget of $1,000,000. The goal is to drill a total of 100 million dollars of oil from the North Sea.

Each turn begins with allocating the weekly budget to drilling consumables, maintenance spares, food, and charter berths. This gear is loaded into a supply vessel, and player must travel from Aberdeen, Scotland to the Dragon Delta located 260 nautical miles away. The player must control for wind and tides in their navigation. The more attempts it takes to reach the destination, the more supplies that are swept overboard on arrival.

Once supplies are safely aboard the Dragon Delta, workforce must be apportioned to drilling, maintenance and services. The Dragon Delta is then positioned on the North Sea to initiate drilling. A number appears above each location drilled, and the closer to the center of oil that turn, the higher the oil return. The player has several drilling attempts to locate this. At the end of each turn a balance sheet demonstrates current oil production.
title: North Sea Oil

description:
Dragon Family Programs is a collection of programs and games for the Dragon 32.

  • Battle: Two players control tanks that can move in the cardinal directions and fire forwards. The players must navigate slowly disintegrating terrain. Each player can fire five times, and if both players use all five shots they get five more bullets.
  • Finance: Comprehensive mortgage and savings calculator.
  • Maths: The player must answer a math question before a timer runs out. There are three levels of difficulty.
  • Oddjob: Date calculator, action game, reaction timer, and sketch pad.
  • Quiz: Knowledge test with over 750 Questions.
  • Ringo: 1–6 player game where the player tries to thread a wire through a ring.
  • Sarah: A memory game of sound and color.
  • Tunes: The player tries to guess a short tune. There are over 100 songs in total.
title: Dragon Family Programs

description:
Fun & Games is a compilation of games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Anagrams: Try to guess the names of eight British towns with rearranged letters.
  • Artist: The computer creates a random picture by setting four parameters. The computer then judges which picture is best.
  • Brain: Mastermind game, where the player has 10 guesses to solve a pattern. Each turn the player is told how many guesses are correct and in the correct position.
  • Circles: Matching game where players must match circles of the same size that flash the same color when selected.
  • Dice: The player rolls five dice, and gets three rolls per turn to try to make poker hands. The player has 200 seconds to maximize score.
  • Donkey: Try to pin the tail on the donkey while blindfolded. A sound indicates how close the player is to their goal.
  • Gold: Move the cross across the minefield before time runs out. Hit four mines, and it's game over.
  • Musical: A game to help play musical chairs.
  • Noughts: Tic-tac-toe game versus the computer. There are two levels of difficulty.
  • Snap: Cards are displayed on the screen, and the player must hit a button when two cards with the same number are displayed in a row.
title: Fun & Games

description:
Hooked! is a 1–2 player fishing game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a fisherman at the left of the screen, while two large fish swim in the water to the right. The player attempts to position the rod tip over a fish's head, and then sets the depth of the cast. The rod length and depth will constantly change, adding challenge to the cast.

If the line casts into the bottom, the line becomes snagged. At which time the man stands up. The player must enter a number from 1–10. Too high, and the line breaks. Too low, the player can try again. Three low guesses also leads to the line breaking, and the player loses time re-tackling.

A successful cast leads to a landing net being placed in the water. The player must guide the fish into the net. If the fish is brought too close to the surface, too close to the frame of the landing net, or into the weeds, the line might break and the fish escapes.

The player can choose from three difficulty levels, moving or stationary fish, and timed game or unlimited play. The player receives points for the size and number of fish caught.
title: Hooked!

description:
Fun to Learn is a package of educational games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Calculator: Add a series of numbers to make a steadily larger sum
  • Codebreaker: Use the displayed code to solve a cryptogram
  • Counting: Try to count the number of letters displayed on the screen
  • Starship: Space-themed hangman game
  • Word Mixer: Unscramble the letters in a word

sample_screenshots.caption: Calculator: Solving a Long String of Numbers

title: Fun to Learn

description:
Junior Pack contains two educational games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Tables: The student uses math skills to guide the cursor to safety on a maths table.
  • Jumbler: Word recognition game where the player finds missing letters to complete the sentence.
title: Junior Pack

description:
Monster Maths is an educational program with games for the Dragon 32/64.

Contains math practice programs for addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. It also has practice counting rectangles and times tables. Contains two games: Monster-Maths and Mystery-Numbers. There are nine levels of math difficulty.

In Monster-Maths, the player competes against their friend to answer a number of questions in 30 seconds. If they complete the challenge, their friend is eaten by a monster.

In Mystery-Numbers, the player is given a list of 3 to 10 numbers depending on difficulty. The goal is to add, subtract, or multiple the numbers to reach a specific sum, with points awarded depending on how close the final result is.
title: Monster Maths

description:
Puzzler is a 1-player block puzzle for the Dragon 32/64.

A picture is divided into a 4 x 3 grid, and the image is rearranged. The player can switch any two pieces to change their position. Images include Basic Flag Design, Union Jack, Big Cat, or Fish Tank. There are five difficulty levels, which determine how many moves the player has to complete the puzzle. If the player takes too long to make a move, the computer will make a random move.
title: Puzzler

description:
Quiz Pack is a 1-player quiz game for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Crossword: The computer creates a 10-word crossword puzzle from 500 possible question/answer combinations.
  • Wordwise: The player is given a short clue where the answer is a single word. The game is divided into three rounds, with a new letter of the word shown every 5, 3, and then 2 seconds. The player receives points for every word solved. The player has 150 seconds to solve as many words as possible.
title: Quiz Pack

description:
Movie Producer is a puzzle game with adventure elements for the Dragon 32/64.

Famed film entrepreneur Peeko Sputberg has started his quest to make movies on London's Film Row, Wardour Street. Each film's company will either help Sputberg make the film or throw him out.

At the start of the game, the player has 10 moves to find a film company that will finance the player's film. After finding a backer, the player enters an adventure game component where they must move through the production offices to find the room containing the finished script. Commands are via text entry. Each move costs 1 day and $500,000. The film must be found and completed on time and within schedule.
title: Movie Producer

description:
Basil Goes Ballooning is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Field Marshall Basil Spice, well known gourmet, raconteur and bon vivant, has arrived at Brighton for a well-earned weekend break. Weary from his effort to plan the British war campaign, he takes a rest on his estate. Unfortunately, Brighton has come under attack by a pack of scavenging dodo birds. Armed with his trusted blunderbuss and three barrage balloons, Basil must save Brighton from the dodo invasion.

The player controls Basil's balloon, which can move in all directions. Basil can fire a short distance left or right, but must be careful not to hit his own bullets or the enemy planes, dodos, or other dangers that move through the sky. Any damage to his balloon and Basil experiences an unhealthy descent. Lose three balloons, and it's game over. Every 5000 points, the dodos fly faster and the blunderbuss range is shortened.
title: Basil Goes Ballooning

description:
Sunken City is a 1-player adventure game with RPG elements.

The year in 1850, and Professor Ellis is close to completing his time machine. Just one item is missing — the Wheel of Time — which lies somewhere in the sunken remains of the great Myrian city. The professor has sent his most trusted assistant on a worldwide quest to find the sunken city and return home with the Wheel.

The player is represented by a blue dot, which moves across maps, including a large one representing the surface of the Earth. As the player moves through various locations, they engage in combat, the results of which are automatically determined by the player's weapon and armor. The player's statistics include mortality, food, and sovereigns.

Certain locations include dungeons, towns, or healing sites In these areas, the player can talk to local shopkeepers and inhabitants for clues or to purchase items and equipment. Means of transportation can be purchased to further explore the map.
title: Sunken City

description:
Othello is a 1-player board game for the Dragon 32/64.

A 1-player game against five levels of AI opponent. Played on an 8 x 8 board, the player inputs coordinates of playable squares. The player or computer can move first, and the players take turns adding colored stones. This switches all the opponent's stones positioned between the two pieces to the player's color. When the board is full the game ends and the player with the most stones wins.
title: Othello

description:
Sam Buick is a detective-themed text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

Starting in his office reeking of stale coffee, Sam Buick must explore the streets of Noo York City to solve a murder mystery for his beautiful new client.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Sam Buick

description:
Besieged is a 1-player word puzzle game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a knight who tries to enter a besieged city. In order to do that, they must correctly guess a word from the clue provided. Depending on game type, the player may have some rearranged letters from the answer available. The player gains 2 points for every correct letter. If the player types three incorrect letters, they open up a passage for the invaders to storm the castle. The player beats the levels if they successfully enter the castle five times in a row.
title: Besieged

description:
Searchword is a word search game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player types in a list of words to search for, and the program automatically creates the word search puzzle. Hidden words are selected by typing the starting point and the direction of the word.
title: Searchword

description:
Missile Defender is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

Invaders are attacking the Earth with their new Hyper Missiles, which never miss. The player must defend the world and people from waves of missiles. The world's defense consists of two large laser bases on opposite sides of the bottom of the screen. The player controls the target using a crosshair, and the player has limited energy power to shoot down incoming missiles. The player starts with 10 bases, and receives points for destroyed missiles and bases and lasers remaining at the end of each level. When all bases or all lasers are destroyed, it's game over. There are five levels of difficulty.
title: Missile Defender

description:
The Tiger Grand Prix is an educational 1–2 player quiz game for the Dragon 32/64.

The computer displays a race track with two cars. To move along the track, the player rolls dice. Once the car stops moving, a question board appears. The player will gain or lose positions with a correct or incorrect answer. Once the car has moved 8 places, the mad Gremlins appear on the track to chase the player. The Gremlin will move towards the player 4 places each turn. The game contains multiple stages, which consist of different difficulty of questions.
title: The Tiger Grand Prix

description:
Ace High MK 2 is a World War II-themed flight game for the Dragon 32/64.
