It's summer 1940, and German bombers often darken the sky over Britain in waves of one hundred or more. Their fighter escort is close at hand. They outnumber the British 4:1. The player must control their Spitfire to shoot down incoming German aircraft.

Played from a first-person perspective, the player's Spitfire can deliver 16 short bursts of machine gun fire. The player can swerve left or right to avoid Messerschmitt 109 sweeping frontal and rear attacks. When the Heinkel opens fire, the player needs to dive to avoid being hit. If the player is hit twice, or sometimes even hit once, their plane is destroyed. Enemy aircraft can take 1 or 2 hits to destroy. The goal is to destroy nine enemy aircraft in a single flight to reach the rank of Ace.
title: Ace High MK 2

description:
Time Attack is a 1-player strategy game for the Dragon 32/64.

The Time Police want to be the Masters of All Time. To prevent Time Ship building, they are destroying British industry. The player has been recruited as a time pilot in the local barracks at Bilston. Bilston is usually swarming with military Time Police, especially in times of rebellion and war. The player can travel through time from 1945 to 1076, otherwise there is evidence they will materialize into a lake or a wall. The player must find the Time Police computer, which exists for one year during this time.

Played from their time machine, the player has numerous menu options to travel through time and search for wayward machines. The player can also exit their machine to do battle with Time Police, firing their blaster. From their time machine, the player can use their limited fuel to travel to different time zones. The player will encounter trivia questions as they appear in different time zones by turning on Mind Probe mode. Fuel can be refilled by discovering the 40 missing time machines. For limited gold, the player can also detect booby-trapped ships, remove a booby trap, locate target century, or use their arm blaster.

The time traveler is also in danger of encountering a deadly serpent. While they have a limited number of antidotes, the snake can also be avoided by re-entering the time machine.
title: Time Attack

description:
Jigsaw is 1-player jigsaw game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player chooses from four jigsaw designs which are each divided into 192 puzzle pieces. The player uses the joystick to move puzzle pieces. Puzzles can be saved in-progress, and the computer can check to see if the puzzle was finished correctly.
title: Jigsaw

description:
Castle Adventure is a text adventure for the Dragon 32/64.

The intrepid hero starts outside the titular castle, with the goal of finding the Staff of Gamroth. The player must confront a number of dangers, including: fountains, mad organists, trap doors, and sea dragons. All instructions are written in VERB NOUN entry.
title: Castle Adventure

description:
Witchway is a graphic adventure game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player travels through a maze to free the miners trapped within. The player can be squished by the walls or killed in other ways.

Opposing the player is the witch Hexate; The goal is to reach her maze at the center and enter the Hex House. Inside the house, the player must find Hexate's wand, which is locked in a safe protected by an electrical grid. There are six difficulty levels.
title: Witchway

alternate_titles.title: Return of the Ring: The Ring of Darkness Part II

description:
Return of the Ring is a single-player role-playing game. In the first game The Ring of Darkness, the player became Ringbearer, wielder of the Four Bright Rings, who has rested the awesome Ring Of Darkness from its guardian Gron, servant of the Evil Sage. The player is now tasked with returning the ring to its creators, the masters of Ringworld. Transported to a mysterious city on a decaying planet, the last vestige of a once great civilization. Communication with planet Aingworld has been broken.

At the start of each game, the player distributes 50 points over 4 statistics: strength, intelligence, charisma, and regenerations. The player then chooses from human, dwarf, or elf race, and technician, warrior, or trader class. This race and class effects overall attributes at the start of game. The game is divided into separate text adventure segments, overland segments where the player can engage in combat with mutants, and 3D sections from a 1st person perspective.

Locations are visually displayed on the screen, and the player can engage in combat with creatures they see on the world surface. Equipment and armor can be picked up and equipped. The player can transact with the residents of the planet to earn clues, gain quests, and buy or sell items. On the world surface are numerous teleporters which can be activated to transport the player to different cities, and pass keys must be obtained to gain access to most new locations.
title: Return of the Ring

description:
Pepper's Games Pack is a series of games released for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Chameleon Run: The player is the pilot of a small chameleon class shuttle craft that tries to reach the 10th level of planet Yarg's deepest crater. The craft can move left and right, and must avoid red, white, and blue debris. The player can color shift between red and white, allowing passage through similar colored debris.

  • Chessboard Tracker: The goal is to trap the computer controlled runner using 2 - 4 player controlled trackers. The runner tries to reach the bottom of the board, while the tracker tries to surround them or force them against a wall. All pieces move diagonally, but the runner can move forwards or backwards. Home squares randomly transport runners and trackers to another corner, while blockouts either allow no movement or only the runner to pass.

  • Masterbrain: A Mastermind game, where the player must solve a 6 or 7 color code in a total of 7 guesses. Each turn they're told if their guesses are the correct color, correct location, or both.

  • Mushroom Muncher: The player tries to destroy all the blue mushrooms on the screen. The player can move in all directions, but only fires vertically forwards. The player must avoid the mushroom guardian, and pick up power pellets to move faster and replenish ammunition.

  • Nad the Necromancer: Sol the Sorcerer's spell book has been stolen by Nad the Necromancer. The player travels on a numbered grid to chase Nad. Squares can contain snakes and trolls. The player casts energy fields to block a single exit. When the player encounters Nad, he will flee to an adjacent room, but not a room containing an energy field, dead end, snake, or troll. The goal is to trap Nad so that he can't escape.

  • Pepper's Breakout: The player controls a horizontally moving paddle at the bottom of the screen as they attempt to bounce a ball to destroy the blocks above. There are 7 levels of difficulty.

sample_screenshots.caption: Nad the Necromancer: I Hear a Hungry Troll

title: Pepper's Games Pack

description:
Aliens+ is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls a small vessel at the bottom of the screen that moves horizontally and fires vertically. Enemy ships move laterally across the top of the screen, move down a small distance, and then reverse direction. Four bases offer protection from incoming enemy fire.

When the enemy vessels are almost destroyed, an alien mothership appears to fire randomly across the screen. When all alien ships are destroyed, the player moves to a faster moving level. The player starts with three ships, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Aliens+

description:
Decathlon is a series of 10 mini games for the Dragon 32/64. The player receives 1 point for each task successfully completed, with the goal to reach 10 points in total.

  • Anagram: The player has limited time to type the solution to the anagram displayed on the screen.
  • Blocker: The player tries to move their block from the top left to the bottom right of the screen while black boxes fill in spaces. The goal is to reach the destination before becoming blocked.
  • Caterpillar: Move the ever-elongating caterpillar through a small maze to eat all the purple blocks before time is up.
  • Chopper: Take off, land on the other side of the mountains, and return before time runs out. The player must avoid hitting the ground too hard.
  • Cuckoo: A bird flies across the screen, and the player must time the egg release so it lands in the nest at the bottom of the screen.
  • Hangman: The player has 60 seconds or 10 incorrect guesses to try to fill in the letters of the mystery word.
  • Shoot-Out: The player tries to shoot their opponent without getting shot. The player must fire their gun after their challenger unholsters, but before they get their shot off.
  • Spider: Using the arrow keys, the player must move a fly and avoid the spiders for one minute.
  • Squares: A 3 x 3 sliding block puzzle where the player must correctly rearrange the puzzle before time runs out.
  • The Doors: The player chooses one of three doors trying to avoid the dragon.
title: Decathalon

description:
Dragon Startrek is a 1-player strategy game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player controls the USS Enterprise, tasked with destroying all the Klingon vessels lurking in a 10 x 10 sector map. The vessel is controlled by rotating and applying thrust. The ship is armed with phasers that are used to destroy enemy ships. Taking damage from Klingon vessels and firing phasers depletes energy. The player manages shield control and photon torpedoes. Maintaining shields costs energy, but the ship will be quickly destroyed by hostile vessels if inactive.

The warp drive is utilized to move between sectors, while galactic search allows scanning of nearby sectors. Status reports allows evaluation of ship damage. When ship sections become damaged they are inoperable until sufficient time has passed to enact repairs.

Sectors can contain starbases which allow the player to replenish energy, stars which are unnavigable, black holes which instantly move the ship to another sector, and planets which can be landed on for mining. Radio pulsars make sectors unscannable from a distance, while sectors with a nova constantly deplete shields. Meteors pose dangers to navigation, but these can be destroyed by photon torpedoes.
title: Dragon Startrek

description:
Evictor is a 1-player arcade game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player's task is to destroy an alien base which has an atomic reactor that regenerates energy blocks as a protective shield. The base is defended by two pairs of guns and alien spaceships that appear and vanish randomly. The player controls a flying saucer which automatically flies back and forth over the alien base.

The player is armed with phasers that can destroy yellow alien space ships, lasers that destroy green alien space ships and force fields, and bombs that disable enemy guns, enemy blocks, or destroy the base.

The ship starts with 100 percent energy, which is decreased by movement, firing weapons, or hit by alien fire. When energy reaches zero, the player's ship must land to refuel while the enemy regenerates. There are a total five difficulty levels. Final score is based upon how many shots are required to defeat the enemy.

sample_screenshots.caption: A Green Ship Blocks by Attack

title: Evictor

description:
Fruita is a four-reel slot machine gambling game for the Dragon 32/64.

The player starts with 10£, and spends 10 pence per spin. Three of a kind wins, four of a kind provides an extra bonus. The player intermittently can hold 1–4 reels and take a second spin. After that spin, the player sometimes has the opportunity to bounce a reel one place, or bounce 3–5 places.
title: Fruita

description:
Strategy is a 2-player strategy war game for the Dragon 32/64.

Each player controls a team of tanks, planes, and aircraft on a static map. The players can set the amount of time per turn, and the frequency of reinforcements.
title: Strategy

description:
Touchdown is a 1-player flight simulator for the Dragon 32/64.

The player is placed in the cockpit of a large passenger jet with the goal of safely landing on a commercial runway. Played from the cockpit perspective, the wind speed, bearing, altitude, flaps, air speed, remaining fuel, and distance to runway are displayed. The player controls the speed, bank, ascent, descent, flaps, and carriage of the vessel.
title: Touchdown

description:
Triplet is a collection of three puzzle games for the Dragon 32/64.

  • Breaker: The player tries to solve a code from 1–9 characters in length. This can be represented by up to eight colors or 26 letters. Each turn the player is told how many positions are correct and/or in the correct position.
  • Copycat: The player must memorize and repeat a sequence of sounds, numbers, colors, and shapes. There are nine levels of difficulty.
  • Tile: A sliding-block puzzle where the player rearranges the letters in the alphabet. 3 x 3, 4 x 4, and 5 x 5 puzzles are available.
title: Triplet

description:
Wizard is a 1-player action game for the Dragon 32/64.

The wicked wizard has imprisoned the player in a magical land to await his return. In order to escape, the player must construct a magical potion to confront the wizard with when he reappears. The game play takes place on an 8 x 10 grid that constantly shifts upwards.

The goal is to gather 6 bats, 6 newts, 6 toads, 6 lizards, a cauldron, 2 magic spells, and a phial to hold the potion. These are represented by letters on the screen. If the player tries to collect more than the needed number they will actually lose an item. If the player falls off the top of the screen, it's game over. Numerous colored squares lead to special encounters which can add or cost the player items.
title: Wizard

description:
Lazerbyx / Thermo Nuclear War are two action games for the Dragon 32/64 packaged together.

Laserbyx is a 2-player light cycle game. Each player controls a thin line representing a light cycle, which leaves a permanent trail streaking behind them as they move through a maze. The goal is to force the opponent to hit a wall, an obstacle, or the trail of another cycle. Each cycle starts at a home base represented on the screen. There are a total of 15 rounds per game, and each round is worth progressively 1 more point to the surviving cycle.

Thermo Nuclear War is a 1-player game versus the computer, where the player must stop the computer from taking over the world.
title: Lazerbyx / Thermo Nuclear War
